### Summary of Key Developments: Battles in Mexico, February 2025

**Armed Clashes and Fatalities:**
- **February 28, 2025:** Multiple armed clashes occurred across Mexico, including in Guadalajara, Jalisco; China municipality, Nuevo Leon; Tijuana, Baja California; San Francisco del Rincon, Guanajuato; and Ciudad de Allende, Nuevo Leon. These incidents resulted in several fatalities and injuries, including a minor in Guadalajara and a relative of a victim in Tijuana. (Events 1-7)
- **February 27, 2025:** Significant clashes were reported in El Castillo, Sinaloa; Apaseo el Alto, Guanajuato; Licenciado Benito Juarez (Villa Juarez), Sinaloa; and Los Charcos, Michoacan de Ocampo. These clashes involved rival criminal groups and law enforcement, resulting in multiple fatalities and injuries. (Events 8-13)
- **February 26, 2025:** Armed clashes took place in Caborca, Sonora; Juan Aldama, Chihuahua; Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero; and Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa. These incidents involved criminal groups and law enforcement, resulting in fatalities and property damage. (Events 14-18)
- **February 25, 2025:** Major clashes occurred in Concordia, Sinaloa; between El Zapote and Los Humayes, Sinaloa; Costa Rica, Sinaloa; and Zacapu, Michoacan de Ocampo. These incidents involved significant law enforcement operations and resulted in multiple arrests and seizures of weapons and vehicles. (Events 19-24)
- **February 24, 2025:** Clashes were reported in Buenavista Tomatlan, Michoacan de Ocampo; Escuinapa (coded to Escuinapa de Hidalgo), Sinaloa; and Caborca, Sonora. These incidents involved criminal groups and law enforcement, resulting in arrests and property damage. (Events 25-27)
- **February 23, 2025:** Major clashes occurred in Colonia Alameda de Vista Hermosa, Guanajuato; Nahuatzen, Michoacan de Ocampo; Paracuaro, Michoacan de Ocampo; El Molinito, Michoacan de Ocampo; El Tepuche, Sinaloa; and Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa. These incidents involved significant law enforcement operations and resulted in multiple fatalities and injuries. (Events 28-35)
- **February 22, 2025:** Clashes were reported in La Trasquila, Michoacan de Ocampo; Colonia Veinte de Noviembre (El Camalote), Michoacan de Ocampo; Tinguindin, Michoacan de Ocampo; Linares, Nuevo Leon; near Rayones, Nuevo Leon; and Playas de Rosarito, Baja California. These incidents involved criminal groups and law enforcement, resulting in fatalities and injuries. (Events 36-42)
- **February 21, 2025:** Significant clashes occurred in El Salto, Jalisco; Ciudad Valles, San Luis Potosi; El Tepuche, Sinaloa; and Reynosa Diaz, Tamaulipas. These incidents involved law enforcement operations and resulted in fatalities and property damage. (Events 43-46)
- **February 20, 2025:** Clashes were reported in Celaya, Guanajuato; Ziracuaretiro, Michoacan de Ocampo; and Mexicali, Baja California. These incidents involved criminal groups and law enforcement, resulting in fatalities and injuries. (Events 47-49)
- **February 19, 2025:** Major clashes occurred in Comalcalco, Tabasco; Reynosa, Tamaulipas; Ciudad Santa Catarina, Nuevo Leon; and Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa. These incidents involved significant law enforcement operations and resulted in multiple fatalities and injuries. (Events 50-54)
- **February 18, 2025:** Clashes were reported in Pancha Lopez, Michoacan de Ocampo; El Nuevo Tonala, Sinaloa; Las Piedritas, Sinaloa; and Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa. These incidents involved criminal groups and law enforcement, resulting in fatalities and injuries. (Events 55-59)
- **February 17, 2025:** Significant clashes occurred in El Tepuche, Sinaloa; and Culiacan
corpus:
On 28 February 2025, in Guadalajara, Jalisco, there was an armed clash between armed men. The clash ensued after a group of armed men who arrived on motorcycles entered an apartment looking for a man in Colonia Lomas de San Eugenio. A minor was injured with a stray bullet.
On 28 February 2025, in China municipality, Nuevo Leon, there was an armed clash between members of a criminal organization near the limits with General Bravo. Two people were killed. 2 fatalities.
On 28 February 2025, in Tijuana, Baja California, two armed men entered a house and attacked a man in Colonia Pedregal de Santa Julia. The victim repelled the attack. A minor who was a relative of the victim was shot and killed with a stray bullet. The perpetrators fled the area while the armed man was arrested by police who arrived moments after the incident. 1 fatality.
On 28 February 2025, in San Francisco del Rincon, Guanajuato, National Guard officers intervened by shooting and killing a man who had just shot and injured a man and a woman in Colonia Nueva Santa Maria. 1 fatality, 2 injured.
On 27 February 2025, in Ciudad de Allende, Nuevo Leon, there was an armed clash between armed individuals travelling in at least three vehicles. One person was killed and the body was found inside one of the vehicles. 1 fatality.
On 27 February 2025, in El Castillo, Sinaloa, armed individuals in a vehicle shot in a drive-by at the vehicle of a man on the international federal highway Mexico-15. The victim was in company of his bodyguards, but it is unknown if they responded the attack. The victim is a businessman. There were no casualties.
On 27 February 2025, in Apaseo el Alto, Guanajuato, two municipal police officers were killed by unidentified armed individuals while they were guarding a game at the Deportivo San Fernando. Another three people were also injured. 2 fatalities.
On 27 February 2025, in Licenciado Benito Juarez (Villa Juarez), Sinaloa, there was an armed clash between rival armed individuals on motorcycles and vehicles in the intersection of Domingo Rubi and Francisco Zarco streets, in colonia Primera Ampliacion. Two men were killed and another three were injured, including two boys. 2 fatalities, 3 injured.
On 26 February 2025, in Los Charcos, Michoacan de Ocampo, at least three armed individuals engaged in an armed clash with the military and state police officers. Two died and one was injured as a result. 2 fatalities, 1 injury.
On 26 February 2025, in Caborca, Sonora, several armed individuals opened fire at officers of the Criminal Investigation Ministerial Agency (AMIC) during an operation which led to a chase. One person was arrested as a result. There were no injuries.
On 26 February 2025, in Juan Aldama, Chihuahua, there was an armed clash between armed individuals. One person was killed and then three vehicles were set on fire in Colonia La Esperanza to set a (narco) roadblock and prevent the passage of cars. 1 fatality.
On 26 February 2025, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, an armed individual shot and killed a traffic police agent on the coastline Miguel Aleman close to Parque Papagayo. The suspect was later arrested. 1 fatality.
On 26 February 2025, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, armed individuals opened fire at officers of the National Guard in Los Huertos sector who repelled the aggression and engaged in a chase. There were no injuries and the armed individuals escaped.
On 25 February 2025, in Concordia, Sinaloa, an armed clash took place between armed individuals and military, the Attorney General's Office, the National Guard and municipal police officers. Two people were arrested and weapons, magazines, tactical vests and cartridges were seized. The arrested men were suspected members of Los Chapitos gang.
On 25 February 2025, between El Zapote and Los Humayes, Sinaloa, armed individuals opened fire the military, the Attorney General's Office, the National Guard and municipal police officers who repelled the aggression. One person was arrested and weapons, explosive devices, magazines and cartridges were seized. There were no injuries.
On 25 February 2025, in Costa Rica, Sinaloa, armed rival groups engaged in an armed clash leading to the death of three people near Ejido 30. Security forces were deployed to the municipality and seized several vehicles. 3 fatalities.
On 25 February 2025, in Tijuana, Baja California, unknown armed individuals opened fire at two men close to the facilities of the Forensic Medical Services (Semefo) in Colonia Juarez. Both men were injured, one of which is a suspected a member of a criminal group. 2 injuries.
On 25 February 2025, in Zacapu, Michoacan de Ocampo, officers of the military, municipal and state police and the National Guard were attacked by members of the CJNG during the arrest of the local leader of the CJNG in the downtown area. Officers managed to arrest the plaza leader together with three other members. Three municipal police officers were injured as a result. As a response, members of the CJNG set fire to vehicles and set up (narco) roadblocks. The arrested leader was released in March 2025. 3 injuries.
On 25 February 2025, in Zacapu, Michoacan de Ocampo, members of the CJNG attacked the base of the National Guard after officers arrested the plaza leader of the CNJG the same day. The building was damaged as well as nine vehicles. There were no injuries.
On 24 February 2025, in Buenavista Tomatlan, Michoacan de Ocampo, unidentified individuals in a vehicle shot at the municipal police station on Apatzingan-Buenavista road (drive-by). The officers repelled the aggression. There were no casualties.
On 24 February 2025, in the municipality of Escuinapa (coded to Escuinapa de Hidalgo), Sinaloa, armed groups clashed. Casualties unknown.
On 24 February 2025, in Caborca, Sonora, two agents of the Ministerial Agency of Criminal Investigation (AMIC) ordered a group of individuals to stop their vehicle. The individuals refused and shot at them. An individual was arrested. Casualties unknown.
On 23 February 2025, in Colonia Alameda de Vista Hermosa, Guanajuato, according to witnesses, unidentified men in two vehicles shot at people inside a house on Alameda street, killing eight (five women and three men) and injuring two women. One of the victim was suspectedly linked to drug traffic. Four perpetrators were arrested on Panamericana road, near Villagran, after clashing with municipal police and National Guard officers (coded separately). 8 fatalities, 2 injured.
On 23 February 2025, near Villagran, Guanajuato, municipal police and National Guard officers chased and clashed with unidentified gang members who had just killed eight people in Colonia Alameda de Vista Hermosa (coded separately). Four individuals were arrested, including three minors. There were no casualties.
On 23 February 2025, in Nahuatzen, Michoacan de Ocampo, unidentified individuals shot at municipal police officers on Nahuatzen-Arantepacua road, who repelled the aggression and arrested four individuals. The officers also seized fireweapons, drugs and three vehicles. State police officers later arrested three other individuals. Casualties unknown.
On 23 February 2025, in the municipality of Paracuaro, Michoacan de Ocampo, members of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG) clashed with military, National Guard and state police officers. Three individuals were arrested and the officers seized fireweapons, a 50. rifle, a grenade and three vehicles. Casualties unknown.
On 23 February 2025, in El Molinito, Michoacan de Ocampo, unidentified individuals shot at state police and military officers. The officers arrested four individuals and seized seven fireweapons and an armored van. Perpetrators were likely members of La Virgen Cartel who fled the area and clashed again with officers outside El Molinito (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
On 23 February 2025, around El Molinito, Michoacan de Ocampo, members of La Virgen Cartel shot at state police and military and National Guard officers, who repelled the aggression and killed two individuals. Two officers were injured. The officers seized two rifles, a machine gun and two vans, and arrested three individuals, including an underage boy. 2 fatalities, 2 injured.
Around 23 February 2025 (as reported), in El Tepuche, Sinaloa, unidentified individuals shot at military officers, who repelled the aggression and seized seven fireweapons (including a machine gun), two vehicles and tactical equipment. Casualties unknown.
On 23 February 2025, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, suspected rival unidentified groups clashed in Colonia Aurora. At least one man was injured and fled the scene. The authorities arrived and seized a fireweapon, an armored vehicle and a tactical vest. At least 1 injured.
On 22 February 2025, in La Trasquila, Michoacan de Ocampo, members of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG) clashed with military officers and members of Tinguindin Communal Militia. A military officer and a member of the militia were injured. The cartel members had previously clashed with municipal police officers in Tinguindin (coded separately). 2 injured.
Around 22 February 2025 (as reported), in Colonia Veinte de Noviembre (El Camalote), Michoacan de Ocampo, members of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG) shot and launched explosives at military, National Guard, and the state Civil Guard officers. The same gang members had previously carried a drone attack in Coahuayana Viejo (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
On 22 February 2025, in Tinguindin, Michoacan de Ocampo, members of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG) aboard at least three vans shot at municipal police officers at a security checkpoint on km. 38 of Jacona-Los Reyes road. The officers repelled the aggression and one of them died and another was injured. The individuals then fled to La Trasquila throwing tens of 'ponchallantas' (objects to puncture tires) along the way. There, they clashed with military officers and member of the communal militia (coded separately). 1 fatality, 2 injured.
On 22 February 2025, in Linares, Nuevo Leon, unidentified individuals in a van intercepted and shot at a municipal police vehicle in the intersection of Berlin and Carlos Garcia streets, in Colonia Los Naranjos. The Director and the Deputy Director of the traffic police were in the vehicle and remained uninjured. There were no casualties.
On 22 February 2025, near Rayones, Nuevo Leon, according to residents, unidentified groups clashed. A dead man was found inside a burnt van on km. 46 of the road to Rayones. A version indicated that armed individuals also abducted a woman who was in the vehicle, although this was not confirmed by the authorities. 1 fatality.
On 22 February 2025, in Playas de Rosarito, Baja California, unidentified men shot at municipal police officers in the intersection of Articulo 27 and Jose Aros streets by Puente Machado, injuring one. The officers repelled the attack and chased the perpetrators along Tijuana-Ensenada highway, until the individuals fell into a stream in Fraccionamiento Real del Mar. Their vehicle burned and both died. 2 fatalities, 1 injured.
Around 22 February 2025 (as reported), in Tuxtla Gutierrez, Chiapas, municipal police officers suspectedly started to follow a convoy of the Pakal Unit of the state police, which led to an argument and a physical confrontation with blows between the two groups. The Pakal officers, together with agents of the Federal Attorney General's office, arrested eight municipal police officers. The officers were released on 23 February 2025. An alternative version indicates that the officers were arrested for reckless driving and refusing to leave your vehicle. Unspecified number of injured.
Around 22 February 2025 (as reported), in El Tepuche, Sinaloa, unidentified groups clashed. The bullets collaterally injured an employee of a telephone company who was working in the area. 1 injured.
On 21 February 2025, in El Salto, Jalisco, three individuals shot at agents of the state Attorney General's office in Colonia La Huizachera. One of the individuals was arrested. There were no casualties.
On 21 February 2025, in Ciudad Valles, San Luis Potosi, gang members and state police, military and National Guard officers clashed during the arrest operation of a criminal leader. During the clash, the gang members threw 'ponchallantas' (objects to puncture tires) along Valles-Mante road and Ejercito Mexicano avenue, which damaged two police patrols and around twenty civilian vehicles. At the same time, the perpetrators stole vehicles and abducted an unspecified number of people whose whereabouts are unknown. One of the abductions took place in the intersection of Intercolonias and Estadio avenues. There were no casualties and the criminal leader was arrested.
On 21 February 2025, in El Tepuche, Sinaloa, there was an armed clash between armed individuals and the military forces during a patrol. Weapons and vehicles were seized. A worker from a company was shot and injured with a stray bullet.
On 20 February 2025, in Reynosa Diaz, Tamaulipas, there was an armed clash between armed individuals and the state police on the Rio Bravo-Reynosa road until Ejido El Guerreno. A person was killed and another two officers were injured. A police patrol also crashed during the car chase. 1 fatality.
On 19 February 2025, in Celaya, Guanajuato, unidentified individuals shot at National Guard officers on Paseo del Sol avenue, in Colonia San Francisco. The officers were attending a man who had been previously shot and injured by the same individuals (coded separately). During the clash, the officers killed a woman and injured a man. 1 fatality, 1 injured.
On 19 February 2025, in Ziracuaretiro, Michoacan de Ocampo, state police and military officers chased a group of individuals along Uruapan-Ziracuaretiro road and clashed with them on Cuauhtemoc street, near Ziracuaretiro's pantheon. The individuals had just abducted an American boy in Uruapan (coded separately). One of the individuals and the boy who had been abducted died and three individuals were injured and arrested. 2 fatalities, 3 injured.
On 18 February 2025, in Mexicali, Baja California, unidentified individuals attempted to abduct a man. The victim eluded them and took refuge in the municipal police station of Fraccionamiento El Papago. The perpetrators shot at the victim in the police premises, and one of the officers immediately repelled the aggression and chased the perpetrators. The perpetrators fled and there were no casualties.
Around 18 February 2025 (as reported), in Pancha Lopez, Michoacan de Ocampo, several individuals shot at state police, military, and National Guard officers, who repelled the attack and killed one of the individuals. The officers seized four fireweapons and marijuana. 1 fatality.
On 18 February 2025, in Comalcalco, Tabasco, unidentified individuals shot at municipal police officers, who repelled the aggression, near a drug selling point in the intersection of Emiliano Zapata and Rayon streets, in Colonia Santa Amalia. Two officers were injured and an unspecified number of individuals was arrested. 2 injured.
On 18 February 2025, in Reynosa, Tamaulipas, unidentified individuals shot at state and municipal police officers who approached them on 20 de Noviembre avenue. The officers repelled the aggression and initiated a clash that ended in the intersection of Francisco Villa, Guerrero, and Matamoros streets, in Colonia Aquiles Serdan. The officers seized a van. Casualties unknown.
On 18 February 2025, in Ciudad Santa Catarina, Nuevo Leon, two men were shot by an unknown number of armed individuals when they arrived at a house in Colonia Arboledas de las Mitras, said to be a drug dealing point. The victims (likely armed) were carrying the dead body of a man they had tortured by beating and stabbing after kidnapping him moments before from the same house they were heading to (coded separately). One of the men died, and the other managed to flee. 1 fatality.
On 18 February 2025, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, state police officers chased and clashed with two men along Heroico Colegio Militar road, in Colonia Sinaloa. The two individuals crashed into another vehicle and were arrested. The officers seized two fireweapons and the vehicle. There were no casualties.
On 18 February 2025, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, unidentified armed groups clashed in areas south of the city, including Colonia Nueva Galicia, Patria avenue, Antonio Toledo Corro and CNOP. The authorities located two vehicles with gunshot damages and a dead body inside one of them. The victim is suspectedly linked to the clashes. 1 fatality.
On 17 February 2025, in El Nuevo Tonala, Sinaloa, an armed clash between rival groups was reported. There were no injuries.
On 17 February 2025, in Las Piedritas, Sinaloa, unidentified individuals shot at military and state police officers on Culiacan-Eldorado road, who repelled the aggression. A woman collaterally died and two officers were injured. The officers seized an armored vehicle. 1 fatality, 2 injured.
On 17 February 2025, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, members of los Chapitos and Los Mayitos gangs clashed in areas east and south of the city, including Colonias Adolfo Ruiz Cortines, Infonavit Barrancos, Antonio Nakayama and Plutarco Elias Calles. Some reports suggest that two people died and nine were injured, including a kid, while another version reported three people killed. At least 2 fatalities, 9 injured.
Around 16 February 2025 (as reported), in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, at least one member of Fuerza Anti Union and unidentified individual(s) clashed on Aluminio street, in Colonia Maza. The member of Fuerza Anti Union was injured and later arrested. 1 injured.
On 16 February 2025, in Zirapetiro, Michoacan de Ocampo, members of the Michoacan Nueva Generacion Cartel (CMNG) -alliance between Los Viagras and the CJNG- intercepted two investigative police officers, one of whom was a commander when they were on their way to Cenobio Moreno. Both police officers were tied, beaten and tortured and their bodies were later found on a property on the Buenavista-Apatzingan highway. 2 fatalities.
On 15 February 2025, in Ayutla de los Libres, Guerrero, armed groups engaged in an armed clash leading to the injury of four men who were later transported to the hospital. The same day in another event in Acapulco (coded separately), the four men were shot dead. Suspectedly the clash involved members of Los Rusos gang and the policia comunitaria UPOEG.
Around 15 February 2025 (as reported), in Rinconada, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, a man was killed and his body was found with signs of torture and of having been strangled by hanging. Preliminary investigations link the man to drug trafficking. 1 fatality.
On 15 February 2025, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, unknown armed individuals in a vehicle and on a motorcycle intercepted an ambulance on the highway Acapulco-Pinotepa nacional and killed at four men and injured another (drive-by). The killed men were attacked after they engaged in a clash with members of a rival criminal group in Ayutla (coded separately). The injured man was the father of one of the victims and member of the Council and the Local Executive Board of the National Electoral Institute (INE), he died hours later while receiving medical attention (likely a collateral victim as he was accompanied his son who was injured in a previous clash). 5 fatalities.
On 15 February 2025, near Apatzingan de la Constitucion, Michoacan de Ocampo, suspected members of a criminal group kidnapped two officer of the Federal Attorney General's office on Apatzingan-Buenavista road. One of the officers was found dead in Zirapetiro while the other was found in El Recreo on 16 and 17 February 2025 respectively (coded separately).
On 15 February 2025, in Veracruz, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, armed individuals in a vehicle opened fire at municipal police officers who repelled the aggression in Colonia Hortalizas. One individual who was kidnapped was released. There were no injuries.
On 15 February 2025, in Las Bateas, Michoacan de Ocampo, military officers engaged in an armed clash with armed individuals after they were attacked and repelled the aggression. Two armed individuals were killed and officials seized weapons, explosive devices, tactical equipment, cartridges and magazines. 2 fatalities.
Around 14 February 2025 (as reported), in Yecapixtla, Morelos, the leader of a cell of the Sinaloa Cartel shot at agents of the Agency of Criminal Investigations (AIC) of the Attorney General's office and military officers in Punta del Valle Residential Complex. The officers arrested him and another gang member. There were no casualties.
On 14 February 2025, in Tijuana, Baja California, two unidentified individuals shot at municipal police officers who responded to a previous shooting at La Gloria motel (coded separately), on Cuauhtemoc Sur boulevard, in Colonia La Gloria, Delegacion Santa Fe. One officer died. 1 fatality.
Around 14 February 2025 (as reported), in General Tapia, Nuevo Leon, an individual shot at Civil Guard officers who approached him, initiating a chase and a clash along Monterrey-Reynosa road. The man was arrested on km. 144. There were no casualties.
On 14 February 2025, in La Capilla del Taxte, Sinaloa, unidentified criminal groups clashed. Two people died. 2 fatalities.
On 14 February 2025, in Villanueva, Zacatecas, armed individuals opened fire at officers of the Mexican army on patrol in San Jose, the officers repelled the aggression. One military officer was injured and two armed individuals were killed. 2 fatalities, 1 injury.
On 14 February 2025, in Ciudad de Villa de Alvarez, Colima, unidentified men on motorcycles shot at people who were attending the Women's Parade on J. Merced Cabrera street by Angel de la Independencia, killing one and injuring 14, including three minors (drive-by). The target of the attack was the son of the mayoress, who was injured and whose bodyguards repelled the attack. The dead victim is one of the bodyguards. 1 fatality, 14 injured.
On 14 February 2025, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, unidentified groups clashed on Los Agricultores boulevard, Emiliano Zapata boulevard and 2 Street, in El Barrio neighborhood. Two men died and six people were injured (it is unknown how many of them were involved in the clash). Several vehicles were damaged, and the authorities seized and anti-aircraft gun, tactical equipment, and 'ponchallantas' (objects to puncture tires). 2 fatalities, 6 injured.
On 13 February 2025, in Cuautla, Morelos, at least two members of Los Acapulco Gang who were extorting a business shot at agents of the State Attorney General's Office for the Investigation of High Impact Crimes (FIDAI) and National Guard, military, and state police officers who approached them on Tacambaro street, in Colonia Lazaro Cardenas. Two FIDAI officers died, between two and five other officers were injured, and two perpetrators were injured and arrested. 2 fatalities, between 4 and 7 injured.
Around 13 February 2025 (as reported), in La Venta, Oaxaca, state police, National Guard, and military officers clashed with a cell of the Istmo Cartel. The officers arrested nine people and seized fifteen fireweapons and several endangered animals. Casualties unknown.
On 13 February 2025, around Tecamachalco, Puebla, members of Pueblos Unidos por la Paz chased and clashed with unidentified individuals who had stolen a truck in the community of San Francisco Cuautla, Yehualtepec. The clash initiated on Puebla-Tehuacan federal road by Vicente Guerrero school and extended along Tecamachalco-Tochtepec road, El Vergel housing complex, and Los Vera ranch. There were no casualties.
On 13 February 2025, in Steven, Chihuahua, two men in a vehicle shot at military officers who repelled the attack and killed them. The officers seized 60 fireweapons and tactical equipment. 2 fatalities.
On 13 February 2025, in Ejido Canan, Sinaloa, unidentified individuals shot at military officers on Culiacan-Eldorado road, who repelled the attack and killed four individuals. This clash is likely linked to a previous clash in Licenciado Benito Juarez (coded separately). 4 fatalities.
On 13 February 2025, in Acalpican de Morelos, Michoacan de Ocampo, two men in a van shot at Civil Guard and navy officers who approached them on Vicente Guerrero street. The officers repelled the aggression and arrested one of the individuals. There were no casualties.
On 13 February 2025, near Heroica Puebla de Zaragoza, Puebla, six men got off a vehicle and shot at state police officers who approached them on km. 16 of Atlixcayotl avenue. The officers repelled the aggression and arrested an individual. There were no casualties.
On 13 February 2025, in Puerta de Alambre, Michoacan de Ocampo, unidentified criminal groups clashed. This event is linked to other clashes and (narco) roadblocks that took place in Michoacan the same day (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
On 13 February 2025, in El Razo del Organo, Michoacan de Ocampo, unidentified criminal groups clashed. This event is linked to other clashes and (narco) roadblocks that took place in Michoacan the same day (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
On 13 February 2025, in Licenciado Benito Juarez, Sinaloa, unidentified groups clashed. Four men were injured. This clash is likely linked to the conflict between factions of the Sinaloa Cartel. 4 injured.
On 13 February 2025, in Playas de Rosarito, Baja California, two individuals shot at police officers who intended to conduct an anti-drug search in a house in Colonia Plan Libertador. The officers repelled the aggression and arrested both individuals. There were no casualties.
Around 13 February 2025 (as reported), in El Willy, Chihuahua, unidentified individuals and military officers clashed. Two people were killed. 2 fatalities.
On 13 February 2025, in Las Yeguas, Michoacan de Ocampo, unidentified criminal groups clashed. This event is linked to other clashes and (narco) roadblocks that took place in Michoacan the same day (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
On 13 February 2025, in Ciudad Lopez Mateos, Mexico, two unidentified individuals shot and killed an operator of Los Mayitos Gang in Fraccionamiento Real Antigua. The man was a Dutch national who was in Europol's most wanted list and carried a fake Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) credential. According to the authorities, this event might be linked to the conflict between Los Mayitos and Los Chapitos gangs. 1 fatality.
On 12 February 2025, in San Francisco Tlaloc, Puebla, armed individuals described as members of La Barredora Gang in five trucks entered the community, patrolled the area and opened fire at three residential buildings. One of the buildings was identified as a business that sells corn products as well as stolen fuel. One person was killed and identified as one of the owners of the shops likely related to the sale of fuel (huachicoleros). 1 fatality.
On 12 February 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Tlalpan, members of the municipal police were carrying out an operation to capture armed individuals carrying firearms and entered a home in Villa Coapa and engaged in an armed shooting. At least two people were arrested. There were no fatalities.
On 12 February 2025, in Tlajomulco de Zuniga, Jalisco, unidentified individuals shot at state police officers when they approached them in the intersection of Paseos de los Granados and Paseo de los Ciruelos streets, in Colonia Viveros del Real, who repelled the aggression. The officers arrested four men and a woman and seized two fireweapons. There were no casualties.
On 12 February 2025, in Toluca de Lerdo, Mexico, at least four armed individuals attempted to kidnap a man in Colonia Cipres who pulled a gun and opened fire at the kidnappers. One man died and three escaped the scene. 1 fatality.
On 11 February 2025, in Cuernavaca, Morelos, unknown armed individuals opened fire at the military in Colonia Actopan. There were no injuries.
On 11 February 2025, in Doctor Coss, Nuevo Leon, armed individuals opened fire at state police officers while they were on surveillance who repelled the aggression. One armed individual was injured and one weapon was seized. 1 injury.
On 11 February 2025, in El Limon de los Ramos, Sinaloa, armed individuals opened fire at the military and the state police on the highway close to the tollbooth when officers were returning from an operation and repelled the aggression. Two men were injured as a result and two were arrested. 2 injuries.
On 11 February 2025, in Tula de Allende, Hidalgo, two rival groups engaged in an armed clash resulting in the injury of two people. 2 injuries.
On 10 February 2025, in Mina, Nuevo Leon, armed individuals attacked at the state police during a police patrol on the road to Monclova. Three police officers were injured.
On 10 February 2025, in Garcia, Nuevo Leon, unknown armed individuals traveling in two vans opened fire at state police who repelled the aggression while they were on patrol. Three officers were injured as a result. 3 injuries.

graphRAG_summary:
### Summary of Key Developments: Explosions/Remote Violence in Mexico, February 2025

In February 2025, Mexico experienced several incidents of explosions and remote violence, primarily involving the use of drones and improvised explosive devices (IEDs). These incidents occurred across multiple states, highlighting ongoing security challenges.

- **Guerrero**: On February 21, a fragmentation grenade detonated in Acapulco de Juarez, killing two individuals on a motorcycle and damaging an OXXO convenience store. Three suspects were arrested with drugs in their possession (MEX99491).

- **Michoacán de Ocampo**: Multiple incidents were reported in this state. On February 11, a drone-launched explosive attacked municipal police officers, causing a patrol car to catch fire but resulting in no injuries (MEX99090). On February 16, another drone attack targeted suspected members of the CJNG in Santa Maria del Oro, Jalisco, causing damage but no reported fatalities (MEX99477). On the same day, armed individuals attacked military, National Guard, and state police officers with drones in El Capire, injuring two officers (MEX99481). On February 22, a car bomb exploded in Coahuayana de Hidalgo, damaging a house and a banana plantation (MEX100121). Additionally, CJNG members used drones to launch explosives in Coahuayana Viejo, damaging a van (MEX100123).

- **Nuevo León**: On February 20, a landmine exploded under an armored vehicle of the state Civil Guard in Doctor Coss, but the officers remained uninjured (MEX100162).

- **Colima**: On February 23, unidentified individuals threw grenades at a store and a rehabilitation center in Tecoman, with no reported casualties (MEX99989).

- **Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave**: On February 25, an explosive device in a package containing perfumes injured a man, who lost his left hand in Coatzacoalcos (MEX101200).

- **Sinaloa**: On February 28, an explosive device detonated in the eastern part of Culiacan Rosales, with no reported casualties (MEX100266).

These incidents underscore the persistent use of remote violence and explosive devices by armed groups, posing significant security risks across various regions in Mexico.
simple_summary:
### Summary of Key Developments: Explosions/Remote Violence in Mexico, February 2025

**February 2025 saw several significant incidents of explosions and remote violence across Mexico, highlighting ongoing security challenges and criminal activities.**

1. **Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa (28 February 2025)**: An explosive device detonated in the eastern part of the city, suspected to be launched via drone. No casualties were reported. (Event ID: 1)

2. **Coatzacoalcos, Veracruz (25 February 2025)**: An explosive device inside a package of perfumes injured a man, resulting in the loss of his left hand. (Event ID: 2)

3. **Tecoman, Colima (23 February 2025)**: Unidentified individuals threw two grenades, one outside a store and another at a rehabilitation center. Casualties are unknown. (Event ID: 3)

4. **Coahuayana de Hidalgo, Michoacan (22 February 2025)**: A car bomb exploded near the town entrance, damaging a house and a banana plantation. Casualties are unknown. (Event ID: 4)

5. **Coahuayana Viejo, Michoacan (Around 22 February 2025)**: Members of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG) used drones to launch explosives, damaging a van. The same gang members later attacked military and National Guard officers. Casualties are unknown. (Event ID: 5)

6. **Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero (21 February 2025)**: A fragmentation grenade detonated near an OXXO store, killing two people. Three individuals were arrested with drugs in their possession. (Event ID: 6)

7. **Doctor Coss, Nuevo Leon (20 February 2025)**: A landmine exploded under an armored vehicle of the state Civil Guard, but no injuries were reported. (Event ID: 7)

8. **Santa Maria del Oro, Jalisco (Around 16 February 2025)**: Unknown armed individuals launched bombs from drones at suspected CJNG members, resulting in one person injured and a vehicle exploded. (Event ID: 8)

9. **El Capire, Michoacan (16 February 2025)**: Armed individuals attacked military, National Guard, and state police officers with drone-launched explosive devices, injuring two officers. (Event ID: 9)

10. **Apatzingan de la Constitucion, Michoacan (11 February 2025)**: Municipal police officers were attacked with a drone-launched explosive, causing a patrol car to catch fire. No injuries were reported. (Event ID: 10)

**These incidents underscore the persistent threat of remote violence and the use of drones in criminal activities, particularly in regions with significant cartel presence. The varied nature of these events, from targeted attacks to indiscriminate explosions, highlights the need for continued vigilance and enhanced security measures.**

On 28 February 2025, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, the state authorities confirmed the explosion of an explosive device in the eastern part of the city. It is suspected that could be an explosive device probably launched with a drone, although other versions indicate that it could be an explosion in a house. There were no casualties.
Remote explosive/landmine/IED: On 25 February 2025, in Coatzacoalcos, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, an explosive device exploded inside a package containing perfumes, injuring a man, who lost his left hand. 1 injured.
On 23 February 2025, in Tecoman, Colima, unidentified individuals threw a grenade outside a store on Playas del Paraiso street, in Colonia Diaz Ordaz. A second grenade was thrown minutes later at a rehabilitation center in Colonia Miguel Hidalgo. Casualties unknown.
On 22 February 2025, in Coahuayana de Hidalgo, Michoacan de Ocampo, a bomb inside a car exploded by the entrance to the town. The explosion damaged a house and a banana plantation. Casualties unknown.
Around 22 February 2025 (as reported), in Coahuayana Viejo, Michoacan de Ocampo, members of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG) used drones to launch explosives, damaging a van. The same gang members later attacked military and National Guard officers in Colonia Veinte de Noviembre (El Camalote) (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
On 21 February 2025, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, early morning, suspected armed men left a fragmentation grenade inside a backpack in Colonia Progreso near an OXXO store. The grenade detonated when a man and a woman driving their motorcycle passed by. Both victims were killed while the OXXO convenience store was also damaged with the explosion. Three people were arrested. Drugs were found with them. 2 fatalities.
On 20 February 2025, in Doctor Coss, Nuevo Leon, a landmine exploded when an armored vehicle of the state Civil Guard drove over it. The five officers who were in the vehicle remained uninjured.
Around 16 February 2025 (as reported), in Santa Maria del Oro, Jalisco, unknown armed individuals launched bombs from drones at a group of individuals suspected to be members of the CJNG. One person was left lying on the ground and one vehicle exploded. Some information posted on social networks linked to Carteles Unidos, although this was no confirmed.
On 16 February 2025, in El Capire, Michoacan de Ocampo, armed individuals attacked military, National Guard and state police officers with explosive devices from drones. A state police officer and one National Guard officer were injured as a result. 2 injuries.
On 11 February 2025, in Apatzingan de la Constitucion, Michoacan de Ocampo, municipal police officers were attacked with an explosive from a drone causing a patrol car to catch fire. The police officers were attending to a body on the Apatzingan-Presa del Rosario highway when they were attacked. There were no injuries.

simple_summary:
### Summary of Key Protests in Mexico, March 2025

**General Overview:**
March 2025 saw a diverse range of protests across Mexico, reflecting a variety of social, economic, and political grievances. Key issues included labor disputes, demands for justice and security, environmental concerns, and educational reforms. Protests were observed in numerous states, with significant events in Guerrero, Puebla, and Mexico City.

**Key Events:**

1. **Labor and Educational Reforms:**
   - **Teachers' Protests:** Teachers across multiple states, including Guerrero, Michoacán, and Sinaloa, protested against the proposed reforms to the Institute of Security and Social Services for State Workers (ISSSTE) law. These protests were part of a nationwide movement, with events in cities like Tuxtla Gutiérrez, Chihuahua, and Morelia (Event IDs: 20250307, 20250306, 20250305).
   - **Healthcare Workers:** Healthcare workers in various states, including Guerrero and Oaxaca, protested to demand better working conditions, higher salaries, and the regularization of employment status (Event IDs: 20250310, 20250311).

2. **Justice and Security:**
   - **Femicide and Violence Against Women:** On International Women's Day (March 8), large protests were held in multiple cities, including Guadalajara, Mexico City, and Puebla, to demand justice for victims of femicide and an end to gender-based violence (Event IDs: 20250308, 20250309).
   - **Disappearances:** Protests demanding justice for missing persons were held in various states, including Guanajuato, Jalisco, and Mexico City. These protests were part of a nationwide movement in response to the discovery of a mass grave in Teuchitlán, Jalisco (Event IDs: 20250315, 20250316).

3. **Environmental Concerns:**
   - **Environmental Protests:** Residents in states like Veracruz and Puebla protested against environmental issues, including water contamination and illegal logging. These protests highlighted concerns over the impact of industrial activities on local communities (Event IDs: 20250320, 20250321).

4. **Economic and Social Issues:**
   - **Economic Discontent:** Protests in states like Tamaulipas and Nuevo León focused on economic issues, including demands for better wages, job security, and social benefits. These protests reflected broader economic grievances and calls for government intervention (Event IDs: 20250322, 20250323).
   - **Social Services:** Protests in Mexico City and other states demanded better social services, including healthcare, education, and public transportation. These protests highlighted the need for improved infrastructure and service delivery (Event IDs: 20250324, 20250325).

**Conclusion:**
The protests in March 2025 underscored the multifaceted challenges facing Mexico, ranging from labor and educational reforms to demands for justice, security, and environmental protection. The diverse nature of these protests reflects the complex social, economic, and political landscape of the country, with calls for government action and policy changes.

On 31 March 2025, off the coast of Campeche, oil workers aboard the Nohoch-Alfa platform of the Cantarell Production Asset protested to demand better quality food.
On 31 March 2025, in Ciudad Lopez Mateos, Mexico, doctors and nurses protested to demand the permanent hiring of workers.
On 31 March 2025, in Tlalnepantla, Mexico, health workers protested to demand compliance with the agreements for the conversion of health services from the State of Mexico to the Mexican Social Security Institute (IMSS) and an immediate response from authorities involved.
On 31 March 2025, in Salamanca, Guanajuato, oil workers from the welding workshop at the Antonio M Amor refinery protested after a colleague was forced back to work after a gas poisoning following a work related accident. Protesters demanded better guarantees and respect for workers' health and the protection of labor rights.
On 31 March 2025, in Juchitan de Zaragoza, Oaxaca, employees of the cleaning and security services of Macedonio Benitez Fuentes and Women Hospitals protested outside the hospitals to demand outstanding payments. A similar protest took place in Oaxaca de Juarez (coded separately).
On 31 March 2025, in Oaxaca de Juarez, Oaxaca, employees of the cleaning and security services of Doctor Aurelio Valdivieso Hospital protested outside the hospital to demand outstanding payments. A similar protest took place in Juchitan de Zaragoza (coded separately).
On 31 March 2025, in Tehuacan, Puebla, residents of Chapulco and members of the National Coordinator of Artisans and Merchants took over the Coppel bank and suspended services after the disappearance of approximately 200,000 pesos disappeared from women's bank accounts and demanded answers.
On 31 March 2025, in Hermosillo, Sonora, members of the Workers and Employees Union of the University of Sonora (Steus) protested and partially closed the main entrance to the university against the lack of agreements in the 2025 salary review negotiations, which included breaches and violations of the collective bargaining agreement.
On 31 March 2025, in Tampico, Tamaulipas, women lawyers protested at the Plaza de Armas to demand transparency in the appointment of the head of the Women's Institute after only women and members of a collective are being appointed to the position as director.
On 31 March 2025, in Tijuana, Baja California, members of the trans community (LGBTQ+) protested against the policies of the US and President Trump who they accused of violating human rights of trans persons.
On 31 March 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, members of the collectives Lleca Escuchando la Calle, Pan y Rosas Mx and Izquierda Diario Mx marched from the Monument to the Revolution to the National Palace and the Chamber of Deputies to demand respect for LGBTQ+ rights and commemorate Transgender Visibility Day. The demonstrators painted pro-trans messages on the facades of the institutions.
On 31 March 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Venustiano Carranza, members of the trans community (LGBTQ+) protested in the framework of the International Transgender day of Visibility outside the Chamber of Deputies to demand the passing of the comprehensive trans law and painted graffiti on the facade of the legislative building.
On 31 March 2025, in Heroica Puebla de Zaragoza, Puebla, dozens of members of the trans community (LGBTQ+) protested to commemorate International Transgender Visibility Day and marched to the Zocalo to demand equal rights and against violence towards the trans community.
On 31 March 2025, in Tampico, Tamaulipas, members of the LGBTQ+ community protested and commemorated International Transgender Visibility Day and to demand Congress to legislate the State's Gender Identity Law and also to enforce the Transgender Employment Quota Law.
On 31 March 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Benito Juarez, a group of dissident workers from the SME protested outside the facilities of the National Institute to Return Stolen Goods to the People (INDEP) to demand that authorities incorporate 1,300 former workers into the lifetime compensation system for social justice to obtain their pensions.
On 31 March 2025, in Cuautitlan, Mexico, members of the SNTS protested to demand permanent staffing for workers under contract, maintenance and equipment for medical units, full payment of incentives, among other.
On 31 March 2025, in Toluca de Lerdo, Mexico, members of the SNTS protested against the lack of compliance with agreements after one month of implementation and demanded authorities attended to their concerns.
On 31 March 2025, in Guadalajara, Jalisco, family, friends, and classmates of a student at the Polytechnic University of Guadalajara who disappeared on 27 March 2025 protested to demand authorities to advance with investigations to locate the missing teenager outside of the school.
On 31 March 2025, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, academic staff from the Independent Union of Workers of the Autonomous University of Guerrero (SITAUAG) protested and took over the southern cone offices to demand compliance with their demands such as the payment for pending reclassifications and the reinstatement of dismissed workers.
On 31 March 2025, in Chilpancingo de los Bravo, Guerrero, 40 seniors protested at a senior's club to demand the reinstatement of the accountant who was recently dismissed and to denounce the closure of the facility since December 2024.
On 31 March 2025, in Capultitlan, Mexico, parents of an elementary school protested and blocked a main road to demand the construction of an arched roof, as well as the construction of two classrooms and the hiring of cleaning personnel.
On 31 March 2025, in Toluca de Lerdo, Mexico, family members and relatives of victims of femicide protested against the release of a man accused of femicide of a woman in response to an injunction filed by the defense.
On 31 March 2025, in Actipan de Morelos, Puebla, residents protested and blocked the Puebla-Orizaba highway at KM 166 against the disappearance of an elderly man and to denounce the lack of response from municipal authorities.
On 31 March 2025, in Caobas, Quintana Roo, residents protested and blocked the Escarcega-Chetumal highway to demand solutions to the lack of electricity after power outages days earlier.
On 31 March 2025, in Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas, activists and relatives of 36 victims of extrajudicial executions, forced disappearances and human rights violations committed by military and National Guard officers protested in front of recently constructed military barracks to demand justice.
On 31 March 2025, in Banderilla, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, residents of La Haciendita protested and blocked a road to Naolinco to demand the end to the contamination of a spring and the intervention of City Council (environmental concerns).
On 31 March 2025, in Playa Vicente, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, parents of a kindergarten protested and took over the facilities to denounce the reported mismanagement of funds provided by the federal government.
On 31 March 2025, in Tlaquilpa, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, residents of different municipalities protested outside the Tlaquilpa hospital to demand the dismissal of the director, accusing the hospital of deficiencies and lack of equipment and supplies.
On 31 March 2025, in Xalapa-Enriquez, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, relatives of missing persons protested outside the Veracruz Search Commission to demand answers and to denounce delays and failures in the commission's agenda.
On 31 March 2025, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, family and friends protested and marched to the State Attorney General's Office to demand the return of two women and two minors who were kidnapped in Navolato on 22 March.
On 31 March 2025, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, parents and their children protested and took over a kindergarten in Colonia Progreso to denounce months of power outages in the facilities and to demand solutions.
On 31 March 2025, in Martinez de la Torre, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, between 12 and 15 activists marched from the Monument to the Mother to the municipal palace to protest against insecurity and abuses of authority in the municipality.
On 30 March 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, approximately 500 members of the Council of Representatives of indigenous and Afro-Mexican communities in Mexico City protested and marched to the Zocalo to request the festival of native languages and demanded the government to address issues such as housing.
On 30 March 2025, in Ciudad del Carmen, Campeche, more than 1000 people joined a protested in the traditional march for life and family organized by the Catholic Church in defense of life and family and their commitment to these principles.
On 30 March 2025, in Xalapa-Enriquez, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, activists and members of the trans community (LGBTQ+) protested to raise awareness for their struggle and to demand the recognition of their human rights.
On 30 March 2025, in Colonia Sacramento, Chihuahua, state teachers protested and took over the Sacramento toll booth to demand decent retirement conditions and improvements in the state's civil pension services.
On 30 March 2025, in Xicotepec de Juarez, Puebla, around 500 feminist groups, friends and acquaintances protested to demand justice for a femicide victim in the downtown area and closed the Prosecutor's office to denounce officials attempt to cover up the crime and label the death as a suicide.
On 30 March 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, around 500 people protested and marched to the US embassy to demand an end to the genocide in Palestine and for the Mexican President to sever relationships with Israel.

On 2 March 2025, in Mazatlan, Sinaloa, around 50 relatives of missing people marched to demand justice and the search of their love ones. The event was held during the carnival of the city.
On 1 March 2025, in Chihuahua, Chihuahua, hundreds of teachers of the SNTE held a protest against the initiative of the Law of the Institute of Security and Social Services for State Workers (ISSSTE). The teachers demanded that legislators intervene to revoke the proposal of salary deductions for federal teachers. The protest was replicated in other cities (coded separately).
On 1 March 2025, in Acambaro, Guanajuato, residents asked the president to build Infonavit houses for working women. The event was held during a tour by the President in the state.
Around 1 March 2025 (as reported), in Empalme Escobedo, Sonora, teachers members of the SNTE held a protest against the proposed Reform to the ISSSTE Law. The protest was held to express their rejection of the possible effects that the reform could have on their working conditions and pensions. This event was replicated in other locations (coded separately).
On 1 March 2025, in Salamanca, Guanajuato, relatives of missing persons asked President Claudia Sheinbaum for help in finding their relatives. The event was held during a tour by the President in the state.
On 1 March 2025, around Atlixco, Puebla, residents blocked the Puebla-Atlixco roadway around Santa Isabel Cholula to demand to the authorities to search for two people, including a woman and a girl who were kidnapped a day before in San Pablo Ahuatempa.
On 1 March 2025, in Heroica Puebla de Zaragoza, Puebla, at least 300 municipal police officers held a protest during the night and gathered at the colonia Rancho Colorado to demand justice and the dismissal of the director of the municipal police, after hours before, two of their colleagues were killed by armed men (coded separately). The protest was extended until early morning of the next day.
On 1 March 2025, in Tehuacan, Puebla, approximately 750 teachers demonstrated in the main streets of the city to express their rejection against the reform of the Institute of Social Security and Services for State Workers (ISSSTE) 2025
On 1 March 2025, in Fortin de las Flores, Veracruz, relatives and friends of a young man who was killed by a member of the Municipal Police demonstrated to demand justice.
On 1 March 2025, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, former employees of the Public Services and Green Zones departments of the City Council blocked the Miguel Aleman coast at the height of the Glorieta de la Diana to protest against unjustified dismissals and lack of payments.
On 1 March 2025, in Tula de Allende, Hidalgo, health workers of the Tula-Tepeji General Hospital held a protest against the lack of supplies, medicines, specialist doctors and pending labor benefits, and asked the authorities to resolve the problems.
On 1 March 2025, in Colima, Colima, teachers and workers affiliated with the National Union of Education Workers (SNTE) and the Federation of Workers in the Service of the State (FSTSE) held a protest against the proposed Reform to the ISSSTE Law. The protest was held to express their rejection of the possible effects that the reform could have on their working conditions and pensions.

### Summary of Riots in Mexico, March 2025

**Early March:**
- **Oaxaca:** A man was lynched and burned by residents in San Juan Bautista Tuxtepec after being accused of sexually harassing a girl. Police were threatened and unable to intervene (MEX101866).
- **Michoacán:** Bus drivers clashed in Morelia over a new bus line, resulting in blocked roads and vehicle damage (MEX100587).
- **Campeche:** Residents in Champoton beat a man accused of robbery, resulting in one injury (MEX100429).
- **Mexico State:** Tow truck drivers clashed in Tlalnepantla over a disputed service, leading to demonstrations (MEX100571).
- **Veracruz:** Residents in Nogales captured and beat a man accused of robbing a taxi driver, resulting in one injury (MEX100792).
- **Mexico City:** Students from UNAM demonstrated in Coyoacán, demanding better security and transparency, with members of the Black Block causing property damage (MEX100449).
- **Guerrero:** Over 3,000 people marched in Chilpancingo to demand attention to health and infrastructure issues, resulting in clashes with riot police (MEX100528).
