Around 31 March 2025 (between 30 - 31 March), near Copales, Sinaloa, there was an armed clash between different groups between Copales and Hacienda el Tamarindo. Two men were killed. One of the victims is suspected to be a member of an organized crime group and the other was caught in the crossfire. Military forces intervened (methods unknown) to protect workers who were in an orchard during the armed clash. 2 fatalities.
On 30 March 2025, in La Palma, Sinaloa, two armed individuals on a motorcycle opened fire at the Navy who were carrying out an operation. Military forces shit back and injured an armed individual who was also arrested. The second individual fled the scene. 1 injury.
On 30 March 2025, in Cadereyta Jimenez, Nuevo Leon, armed men opened fire at police officers in the downtown area of the city. Police officers shot back and chased the armed men. One armed man died as a result. 1 fatality.
On 30 March 2025, in General Bravo, Nuevo Leon, armed men opened fire at state police officers at KM 4 of the Doctor Coss highway . The officers shot back and killed two armed men. 2 fatalities.
On 30 March 2025, in Puerta de Alambre, Michoacan de Ocampo, armed rival groups engaged in an armed clash where drones with explosives were also used. Elements of the National Guard, the military and the National Guard arrived upon which the armed individuals fled the scene. There were no injuries.
On 30 March 2025, in Tlaquepaque, Jalisco, unknown armed individuals shot and killed a mechanic in Colonia Francisco I. Madero. The victim is suspected to sell drugs. 1 fatality.
On 30 March 2025, near Chinobampo, Sinaloa, for the second consecutive day, there were clashes between members of Los Chapitos Gang and Los Mayitos Gang on roads and in mountain communities on the borders of El Fuerte and Choix. The clashes began in Chinobampo a day earlier (coded separately) when an armed group from San Jose de Garcia suspectedly tried to gain territory in the area and advance towards El Fuerte. The area is a strategic route for drug and arms trafficking, historically controlled by the Sinaloa Cartel that connects with the highlands of Chihuahua and Durango. According to residents, during the two days, houses were burned, and explosions similar to bazookas were heard. Unofficially, it was said that one man was killed along with several other men. Official reports indicate that there were no casualties. Unspecified fatalities coded as 3 split over 2 events, 2 fatalities coded here.
On 30 March 2025, in Churipitzeo, Guanajuato, there was an armed clash when armed men kidnapped a state police officer while traveling on the Ojo de Agua Avenida. A person was killed and another person was injured. The kidnapped officer was found dead hours lately. 2 fatalities, 1 injured.
On 29 March 2025, in Tanchachin, San Luis Potosi, unknown armed individuals suspected to be members of the Gulf Cartel opened fire at state police officers who were carrying out an operation. The police officers shot back, killed three men and arrested five individuals. Police officers seized weapons, grenades, tactical equipment and five vehicles. 3 fatalities.
On 29 March 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Alvaro Obregon, three agents of the federal Attorney General's office entered The Westin Santa Fe Hotel to arrest a member of the Sinaloa Cartel during the celebration of his daughter's fifteenth birthday. His escorts and other assistants beat and disarmed the agents, who called for reinforcements of state police and National Guard officers. During the confrontation, the target of the arrest fled. 3 injured.
On 29 March 2025, near Chinobampo, Sinaloa, during the night, there were clashes between members of Los Chapitos Gang and Los Mayitos Gang on roads and in mountain communities on the borders of El Fuerte and Choix. The clashes began in Chinobampo when an armed group from San Jose de Garcia suspectedly tried to gain territory in the area and advance towards El Fuerte. The area is a strategic route for drug and arms trafficking historically controlled by the Sinaloa Cartel that connects with the highlands of Chihuahua and Durango. The clashes continued during the next day's morning (coded separately). According to residents, during the two days, houses were burned, and explosions similar to bazookas were heard. Unofficially, it was said that one man was killed along with several other men. Official reports indicate that there were no casualties. Unspecified fatalities coded as 3 split over 2 events, 1 fatality coded here.
On 29 March 2025, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, armed individuals in four vehicles opened fire a elements of the National Guard, the military, the Attorney General's Office, the State Attorney General's Office, and state police officers who arrived in Colonia Villas de las Cumbres after a report of the presence of armed individuals. The officers shot back killing a person. Another person was arrested and officers seized a vehicle, weapons, magazines and a vest. 1 fatality.
On 28 March 2025, in General Angel Flores, Sinaloa, according to witnesses, unidentified gang members shot at navy officers on General Angel Flores street, in Colonia Fidel Velazquez, who shot back. A man was injured. 1 injured.
On 28 March 2025, in Metepec, Mexico, armed individuals on a motorcycle shot and killed a man in the Infonavit San Francisco area. The man was identified as a drug dealer and suspected member of the Familia Michoacana Cartel. 1 fatality.
On 28 March 2025, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, unidentified individuals shot at state police and military officers on Giovani Zamudio and Benito Juarez La Costerita boulevards, who shot back. Two individuals and a state police officer were injured, and four individuals were arrested. The officers also seized a vehicle, fireweapons, and tactical equipment. 3 injured.
On 28 March 2025, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, military officers and unidentified individuals clashed in Colonia El Barrio. A man and an officer were injured. 2 injured.
On 27 March 2025, in Morelia, Michoacan de Ocampo, ten people (eight men and two women, including a Colombian national) shot at military, National Guard, state police, municipal police, and ministerial federal police officers in Colonia Ricardo Flores Magon. The officers arrested the perpetrators and released a man who had been abducted and injured (coded separately). The perpetrators had previously killed three people in Morelia on 22 March 2025 (coded separately). There were no casualties.
On 27 March 2025, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, gang members shot at military and state police officers in Colonia Lazaro Cardenas, who arrived at the scene in response to a previous clash between gangs (coded separately). The officers shot back and killed an individual, while an officer was injured. During the clash, two civilians (a woman and her child, one of them of American nationality) were collaterally injured. 1 fatality, 4 injured.
On 27 March 2025, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, gang members broke down the doors of a house and set it on fire in Colonia Siete Gotas. A rival group arrived at the scene and initiated a clash that spread across several colonias, including Lazaro Cardenas, 21 de Marzo, Antonio Toledo Corro, Mercado de Abastos, 10 de Mayo, San Benito, Providencia, Aurora, Huizaches, and Villa del Real. During the clash, seven people were killed. Two pick-up vans linked to this event were found with gunshot damages and containing explosives, fireweapons, and tactical equipment on Azucena street and Minas and Patriotismo boulevards. It is suspected that a man ( affiliation unknown) who was at the time of the attack was burned and was treated at the hospital for his injuries. Military and state police officers later arrived in the area and clashed with the individuals (coded separately). 7 fatalities, 1 injured.
On 26 March 2025, in Mina, Nuevo Leon, unknown armed individuals traveling in three vehicles opened fire at the military, the National Guard and the state police who shot back in Colonia Los Remotos. Two armed individuals were killed and officers seized weapons, vehicles, vests and equipment. 2 fatalities.
On 26 March 2025, in Ciudad Rio Bravo, Tamaulipas, there was a shooting between Los Metros and Los Escorpiones gangs after the rupture of the ceasefire between both near the international bridge that spread to the urban area of the city. Near Colonia Ferrocarril there were four another clashes that led to (narco) roadblocks in the area and another (narco) roadblock was set up on the Matamoros-Reynosa highway at the Nuevo Progreso toll.
On 26 March 2025, close to San Ramon, Zacatecas, armed individuals in approximately 12 vehicles opened fire at state police officers who were carrying out an operation and shot back between San Ramon and Guadalupe. Armed individuals escaped and one police officer was injured. 1 injury.
On 25 March 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Iztapalapa, a man who was driving a stolen van on Mexico-Puebla highway, by Colonia San Francisco Apolocalco, shot at municipal police officers who approached him. The officers shot back and killed him. In an attempt to flee, the gunman rammed two patrol cars and ran over two of the police officers. Two officers were injured. 1 fatality, 2 injured.
On 25 March 2025, in San Mateo Tlaixpan, Puebla, unknown armed individuals opened fire at member of the State Attorney General's Office (FGE) who fired back while they were carrying out an operation in Colonia San Isidro. One officer was killed and another officer was injured in the attack. 1 fatality, 1 injury.
On 25 March 2025, close to Boscoso, Sinaloa, armed individuals engaged in an armed clash between Boscoso and Potrerillo del Norte. Police officers seized four explosive devices, three weapons, 15 magazines, 320 cartridges and three ballistic vests. Casualties unknown.
On 25 March 2025, in Hermosillo, Sonora, two unknown armed individuals opened fire at municipal police officers in Colonia Eusebio Kino after they attacked and killed a man (coded separately). Police officers fired back injuring one individual and killing another. 1 fatality, 1 injury.
On 25 March 2025, in Ciudad Obregon, Sonora, six men shot at agents of the Ministerial Agency for Criminal Investigation (AMIC) on Antonio Rosales street, in Colonia Cajeme. The agents shot back and killed an individual and arrested four, while the sixth fled. The officers also seized a firearm, methamphetamine and marijuana. 1 fatality.
On 24 March 2025, in Tanguma, Nuevo Leon, there was an armed clash between armed individuals and the state police on the road to La Cotorra. 8 fatalities.
On 24 March 2025, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, there was an armed clash between armed individuals around Stanza Torralba. A girl was injured with a stray bullet. She died later at the hospital. 1 fatality.
On 23 March 2025, in Ciudad Nezahualcoyotl, Mexico, two men on a motorcycle shot at a man waiting outside a bar who shot back in Colonia Perla. Two men died and three people were arrested. One woman was hit and injured by a stray bullet. 2 fatalities, 1 injury.
On 23 March 2025, in Linares, Nuevo Leon, there was an armed clash between armed individuals and the state police in Colonia La Bohemia. Casualties unknown.
On 23 March 2025, near San Sebastian Coatlan, Oaxaca, there was an armed clash between armed individuals on the Costa Barranca Larga - Ventanilla in Paraje El Limar. Six people were killed and ten people were injured. According to the authorities, the clash was between residents of San Sebastian Coatlan and San Francisco Coatlan over a land dispute and the clash started when residents from San Francisco Coatlan were seen collecting wood. Authorities, declared that the issue itself has already been resolved by an agrarian judge, who issued a ruling in December dividing the disputed land between the two communities. 6 fatalities.
On 23 March 2025, in Heroica Puebla de Zaragoza, Puebla, according to witnesses, armed men shot and killed a man inside a beer business in colonia Bosques de Chapultepec. Another, three people were also injured. One of the injured died days later. The man who died in the event is a suspected criminal linked to vehicle theft and drug dealing. 2 fatalities, 2 injured.
On 23 March 2025, in Cancun, Quintana Roo, two men shot and killed three men suspected to be drug dealers in Fraccionamiento Villas Otoch Paraiso. The attack responded to disputes between unspecified drug-dealing groups, as the victims intended to take over houses to establish drug-selling points. The perpetrators were arrested. 3 fatalities.
On 22 March 2025, around La Barca, Jalisco, there was an armed clash between armed individuals on the Ocotlan-La Barca highway. Casualties unknown.
On 22 March 2025, in Ciudad de Allende, Nuevo Leon, there was an armed clash between armed individuals. One person was killed. It is suspected that the clash started near the Secretariat of Public Security and that the armed men fled along the National Highway towards Santiago and seized a couple of vehicles that were in a car lot. 1 fatality.
On 22 March 2025, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, armed men shot and killed a man while eating at a taco stand on Avenida Lincoln. The victim had drug-dealing records. 1 fatality.
On 22 March 2025, in Ciudad Sabinas Hidalgo, Nuevo Leon, there was an armed clash and a pursuit between armed individuals in two vehicles (drive-by) and the National Guard during a police patrol. After the clash, the police seized two pickup trucks, two long guns, fifty-nine magazines, 1,118 cartridges of different calibers, three bulletproof vests and tire punctures. Casualties unknown.
On 22 March 2025, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, an unknown number of armed individuals shot at a house in colonia Villa Bonita. The house is known drug dealing point. One person was killed. 1 fatality.
On 22 March 2025, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, there was an armed clash between armed individuals in colonia El Barrio. A man was killed and another person was injured. Unofficially it was also informed that one person was kidnapped. The whereabouts of the victim are unknown. 1 fatality, 1 injured.
On 21 March 2025, in Uruapan, Michoacan de Ocampo, several armed individuals opened fire at elements of the National Guard and the military while they were on surveillance in Tejerias. The officers shot back and managed to free a man who was kidnapped and injured by gunshot wounds (coded separately). Three people were arrested.
On 21 March 2025, in Ciudad de Allende, Nuevo Leon, armed men and police officers engaged in an armed clash in Colonia Ignacio Martinez Dominguez. An officer died. The armed men then fled the scene in three vehicles. 1 fatality.
On 21 March 2025, in Aramberri, Nuevo Leon, armed men opened fire at state police officers in Ejido La Florida, in La Esperanza, who shot back. A state police officer died, another was injured, and at least one person was arrested. 1 fatality, 1 injured.
On 21 March 2025, in Tulum, Quintana Roo, nine unknown armed individuals opened fire at the captain of the municipal Secretariat of Security and Citizen protection upon which the target's bodyguards shot back. Two armed attackers were killed as a result and as well as the captain who died the following day. This attack was suspectedly ordered by a criminal leader from Tamaulipas, and responded to operations that the target officer had led in Colima. One of the perpetrators was arrested around 1 April 2025. 2 fatalities, 1 injury.
On 20 March 2025, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, a police officer was attending to a report of a suspicious person and was shot by a man who disarmed the police officer and then stole the unit and fled the scene. The police officer died as a result. Dozens of police officers were mobilized who joined the chase and managed to kill the perpetrator. 2 fatalities.
On 20 March 2025, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, state police attempted to intercept two armed individuals who opened fire at the police and fled the scene in the south of the city. State police officers shot back and managed to arrest both individuals after they crashed. Officers seized drugs at the scene. There were no injuries.
Around 20 March 2025 (as reported), in Heroica Puebla de Zaragoza, Puebla, a man was killed and his body was found wrapped in a blanket inside a drum in Colonia Fundadores de Chapultepec. The victim was identified as a member of a local gag. 1 fatality.
On 20 March 2025, in Caborca, Sonora, armed rival groups engaged in an armed clash leading to the death of three men. 3 fatalities.
On 20 March 2025, in Guadalajara, Jalisco, two men and a woman opened fire at investigative police officers who were carrying out a search in the intersection of Francisco Gomez de Mendiola and Genovevo Rivas Guillen streets, in Colonia La Penal, and then fled the scene prompting police officers to shot back and chase the individuals. One man died and the second was injured. The injured man and the woman were arrested. 1 fatality, 1 injury.
On 20 March 2025, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, armed groups engaged in an armed clash in Colonia El Barrio. During the clash an unspecified number of drones launched explosives. There were no injuries.
On 19 March 2025, in Celaya, Guanajuato, two armed men on a motorcycle shot at the municipal police (drive-by) on Avenida Las Torres. One officer was injured.
On 19 March 2025, in Purificacion, Jalisco, there was an armed clash between members of the CJNG and the National Guard during a patrol. Three officers were killed and several more were injured. The criminal members also burned vehicles and set a (narco) roadblock. This action was replicated on other municipalities in the state (coded separately). 3 fatalities.
On 19 March 2025, in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, there was an armed clash between the state police and armed individuals in a car (drive-by) colonia Nuevo Repueblo. There was a chase and a car accident. Several men were arrested. Casualties unknown.
On 19 March 2025, in La Capilla del Taxte, Sinaloa, there was an armed clash between armed individuals on the libre Durango-Mazatlan highway. Three armed men were killed. 3 fatalities.
On 19 March 2025, in Reynosa, Tamaulipas, there was an armed clash between armed individuals and the state police during a police patrol on the Reynosa-San Fernando highway around Ejido Ideales de la Revolucion. One armed man was killed. 1 fatality.
On 19 March 2025, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, unidentified armed individuals shot and killed at the operational coordinator of the traffic police in colonia Canadas. 1 fatality.
On 18 March 2025, in Santa Fe, Jalisco, members of a criminal group robbed a vehicle. The National Guard and military officers chased the criminals, which led to a car accident and an armed clash. There were no casualties.
On 18 March 2025, around Huiramba, Michoacan, there was an armed clash between the state police and armed individuals on the Morelia-Patzcuaro highway on the Lagunillas-Huiramba road. There were no casualties.
On 18 March 2025, in San Bartolo, Nuevo Leon, there was an armed clash between armed individuals. Two people were killed. 2 fatalities.
On 18 March 2025, in Los Villarreales, Nuevo Leon, State Police officers chased and clashed with armed individuals who were in vehicles and suspectedly had just abducted a woman (drive-by). During the chase, the armed individuals threw the woman from a vehicle, and she was injured. An armed man wearing a bulletproof vest with the words 'Operativo Cienega' was killed. Three pick-up trucks with tactical equipment and an unspecified number of high-caliber weapons were seized by the police. 1 fatality, 1 injured.
On 18 March 2025, in Guadalupe Victoria (El Atoron), Sinaloa, armed individuals opened fire at elements of the National Guard conducting surveillance who shot back. Two armed individuals were killed. 2 fatalities.
On 17 March 2025, in Tulum, Quintana Roo, unidentified individuals shot at the facade of the facilities of the Deputy Attorney General's Office of Quintana Roo. There were no casualties.
Around 17 March 2025 (as reported), in the municipality of Apatzingan (coded to Apatzingan de la Constitucion), Michoacan de Ocampo, four members of Los Viagra Gang shot at military and National Guard officers. The police officers and military forces were carrying out a security operation around the towns of Bateas, El Capire, Las Becerras, Puerta de Alambre, Loma de los Hoyos, Los Charcos and Razo del Organo. The officers arrested the four individuals and seized four fireweapons and tactical equipment. There were no casualties.
On 17 March 2025, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, according to witnesses, unidentified groups clashed in Colonia Lazaro Cardenas. A person died and his body was found on Patriotismo avenue. During the clash, three houses were shot and damaged and one of them was set on fire. 1 fatality.
On 16 March 2025, in Coronado, Chihuahua, unidentified individuals shot at military officers, who shot back. One individual died and two were arrested. The officers also seized three vehicles and fireweapons. 1 fatality.
On 16 March 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, four individuals (including a boy) shot at municipal police officers who attempted to arrest them in a housing complex on Eje 1 Norte and Manuel streets, after they had shot and killed two men (coded separately). The officers arrested them and seized drugs. A line of investigation indicates that the individuals might be members of Fuerza Anti Union. There were no casualties.
On 16 March 2025, in Valle de Santiago, Guanajuato, unidentified individuals shot and killed two municipal police officers who were heading to start their shift on Arteaga avenue, in Colonia Las Haciendas. One of the victim was a commander and the other was his bodyguard. An alternative version indicates that the officers had just finished their shift. 2 fatalities.
On 16 March 2025, in the municipality of La Barca, Jalisco, members of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG) shot at National Guard officers, who shot back near San Antonio de Rivas. The clash extended to Yurecuaro and Tanhuato, in Michoacan de Ocampo, where military and state police officers supported the National Guard. Two National Guard, a military officer, and an individual died and seven officers were injured. An alternative version indicates that this clash initiated in Guadalupe del Lerma, Jalisco. Also, members of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG) and security forces clashed on km. 405 of Guadalajara-Morelia road (La Barca municipality). Casualties unknown. This event is linked to other clashes and (narco) roadblocks in Michoacan and Jalisco the same day (coded separately). 4 fatalities, 7 injured.
On 16 March 2025, in Ocotlan, Jalisco, members of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG) and security forces (likely military forces) clashed on Guadalajara-Morelia highway. This event is linked to other clashes and (narco) roadblocks in Michoacan and Jalisco the same day. Casualties unknown.
On 16 March 2025, in the municipality of Chavinda, Michoacan de Ocampo, members of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG) and security forces (likely military forces) clashed on Santiago Tangamandapio-Chavinda road. This event is linked to other clashes and (narco) roadblocks in Michoacan and Jalisco the same day. Casualties unknown.
On 16 March 2025, in the municipality of Chilchota, Michoacan de Ocampo, members of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG) members threw 'ponchallantas' (objects to puncture tires) on Nacional Morelia-Zamora road, which damaged a military truck. The individuals then shot at the military officers, killing three and injuring two. 3 fatalities, 2 injured.
On 16 March 2025, in the municipality of La Piedad (coded to La Piedad de Cabadas), Michoacan de Ocampo, members of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG) shot at state police officers, who shot back. An officer was injured. To prevent the officers from being reinforced, the gang members looted and burned at least two trailers and used them to set (narco) roadblocks on Occidente highway. This event is linked to other clashes and (narco) roadblocks in Michoacan and Jalisco the same day (coded separately). 1 injured.
On 16 March 2025, in Ensenada municipality, Baja California, two men in a van shot at municipal police officers who ordered them to stop on km. 3,5 of El Tigre interstate road. The officers remained uninjured, arrested the men, and seized a firearm and their van. There were no casualties.
On 16 March 2025, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, unidentified groups clashed on the road to Sanalona, in Colonia Ampliacion El Barrio, with unknown casualties. Also in Culiacan, unidentified groups clashed on Las Brisas boulevard, in Colonia Florida, collaterally injuring a baby. 1 injured.
Around 15 March 2025 (as reported), in the municipality of Villaflores, Chiapas, military, National Guard and state police officers clashed with members of a criminal group dedicated to extortion. Two individuals died and seven were arrested. The officers also seized eight fireweapons. 2 fatalities.
On 15 March 2025, in El Rosario, Sinaloa, unidentified groups clashed. During the clash, at least three explosive devices were detonated. Casualties unknown.
On 15 March 2025, in Tomo, Sinaloa, according to residents, there was an armed clash between members of criminal groups. Houses and vehicles were damaged and drones were used to launch explosives. Local reports indicated that around 12 people were killed, however, this was not confirmed by the authorities. Videos were recorded by residents and shared on social media. The dead body of one of the suspected participants in the clash was found in the area in an advanced state of decomposition and with tactical clothing and equipment around 28 March 2025. Around 12 fatalities.
On 14 March 2025, in Dr. Domingo Chanona, Chiapas, the National Guard and state police officers (Pakal unit) clashed with criminal members during an operation in the municipality. There was another operation and armed clash in Ursulo Galvan (coded separately). During the two clashes that happened in the municipality of Villaflores, two criminal members were killed and another seven were arrested. Authorities suspected that the criminal members are part of the CJNG. 2 fatalities split over two events, 1 fatality coded here.
On 14 March 2025, in Ursulo Galvan, Chiapas, the National Guard and state police officers (Pakal unit) clashed with criminal members during an operation in the municipality. There was another operation and armed clash in Dr. Domingo Chanona (coded separately). During the two clashes that happened in the municipality of Villaflores, two criminal members were killed and another seven were arrested. Authorities suspected that the criminal members are part of the CJNG. 2 fatalities split over two events, 1 fatality coded here.
On 14 March 2025, around Maclovio Herrera (Estacion Falomir), Chihuahua, according to residents, there was an armed clash between rival criminal groups. Casualties unknown.
Around 14 March 2025 (as reported), in Chicoloapan de Juarez, Mexico, two municipal police officers were killed and their bodies were found in colonia La Conchita. Both victims were on duty. 2 fatalities.
On 14 March 2025, in Loma de Potrerillos, Sinaloa, there was an armed clash between armed individuals and military officers during a police patrol. There was a car chase to Rincon de Higueras. Casualties unknown.
On 14 March 2025, in the municipality of Villanueva, Zacatecas, unidentified gangs clashed. One individual died. Members of one of the gangs later shot and killed a civilian in Villanueva (coded separately). Also, unidentified gang members threw tens of 'ponchallantas' (objects to puncture tires) along 54 federal road, damaging at least seven vehicles, including a police car. 1 fatality.
On 14 March 2025, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, there was an armed clash between police officers and armed individuals in Colonia 6 de Enero. A man was arrested. The authorities also seized a grenade launcher and tire-puncturing weapons. There were no casualties.
On 13 March 2025, in Ciudad de Allende, Nuevo Leon, there was an armed clash between criminal members and the municipal police after the police arrested two women, including a criminal leader with a vehicle that was under investigation. Later, four armed men in a vehicle shot at the police in an attempt to release the women. The police shot back. There were no casualties. Both women were arrested.
On 13 March 2025, in Cancun, Quintana Roo, according to witnesses, a group of armed men entered a bar on Avenida Huayacan and shot at a business man. A police officer who was on duty as his bodyguard, shot back. The businessman was killed. Another three people were injured, including the police officer. According to the authorities, the event is suspected to be related to drug dealing. 1 fatality.
Around 12 March 2025 (as reported), in Las Tablas, Sinaloa, unidentified individuals shot at military officers, who shot back with support of National Guard and state police officers and agents of the State and Federal Attorney Generals' offices. The officers injured and arrested an individuals and seized three fireweapons and tactical equipment. 1 injured.
Around 12 March 2025 (as reported), in Los Aldamas, Nuevo Leon, unidentified individuals shot at State Civil Guard officers, who shot back. One individual died and another was injured. 1 fatality, 1 injured.
Around 12 March 2025 (as reported), in Las Bateas, Michoacan de Ocampo, several members of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG) shot at military, National Guard, and State Civil Guard officers who approached them. The officers shot back, killed one individual, injured another, arrested four and seized seven fireweapons. 1 fatality, 1 injured.
Around 11 March 2025 (as reported), in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, unidentified gangs clashed in Colonia Silvestre Castro. Casualties unknown.
On 11 March 2025, in the municipality of Doctor Coss, Nuevo Leon, unidentified individuals shot at state police officers, who shot back and arrested an individual. The officers seized a firearm and tactical equipment. There were no casualties.
Around 11 March 2025 (as reported), in San Nicolas de los Garza, Nuevo Leon, municipal police officers approached six men who were consuming drugs in the intersection of Francisco Villa and Maria Camarena Velez streets, in Colonia Floridos Bosques del Nogalar, and one of them used a machete to attack and injure one of the officers. Another officer shot and injured the individual. The six men were arrested. 2 injured.
On 11 March 2025, in Jonuta, Tabasco, according to witnesses, individuals on a motorcycle shot at municipal police officers on Jonuta-Frontera road by Las Palmas/La Palma ranch, killing one and injuring two (drive-by). 1 fatality, 2 injured.
Around 11 March 2025 (as reported), in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, unidentified groups clashed in Colonia Republica Mexicana. Military and state police officers arrived at the scene and located an abandoned vehicle with gunshot damages on Tulipan street. Also in Culiacan Rosales, unidentified groups clashed in Colonia San Benito. Military and state police officers arrived at the scene and located two abandoned vehicles with gunshot damages on San Angel boulevard. Casualties unknown.
On 10 March 2025, in Maravatio de Ocampo, Michoacan de Ocampo, an armed individual opened fire at the state police who fired back and chased the man upon which he crashed. The injured man was then arrested. 1 injured.
On 10 March 2025, in Villahermosa, Tabasco, according to one of the victims, individuals on a motorcycle and a car shot at a man and a woman in the intersection of Ejido and Nicolas Bravo streets, in Colonia Tamulte de las Barrancas (drive-by). The man died and the woman was injured. The man was a suspected member of a criminal group who had been threatened in previous narco messages. 1 fatality, 1 injured.
On 10 March 2025, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, armed civilians exchanged gunfire in Colonia San Benito leaving two vehicles damaged by bullets. There were no injuries.
On 9 March 2025, in Uruachi, Chihuahua, there was an armed clash between different groups. Shortly after, three men were found dead and burned inside a vehicle (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
On 9 March 2025, in Salamanca, Guanajuato, unknown armed individuals opened fire at two municipal police officers while traveling on the Celaya free highway. There were no injuries.
On 8 March 2025, in Santiago de Queretaro, Queretaro, members of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG) shot and killed four members of La Familia Michoacana Cartel who were inside a vehicle in the parking lot of a bar. One of the victims was the son of the cartel's founder. 4 fatalities.
On 8 March 2025, in Hermosillo, Sonora, three armed individuals opened fire at municipal police officers in the downtown area who fired back and engaged in a chase. All three individuals were arrested and their vehicles, weapons and magazines were seized. There were no injuries.
On 8 March 2025, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, an armed group intercepted a state police officer and attempted to kidnap him. The police officer opened fire at the armed group who fired back and then managed to escape the scene in La Costerita. The officer's vehicle had more close to 200 bullets in it. There were no casualties.
Around 7 March 2025 (as reported), in Celaya, Guanajuato, unidentified men shot at a traffic police officer who was driving on Eje Norte Oriente road. The officer remained uninjured. There were no casualties.
On 6 March 2025, in San Sebastian del Sur, Jalisco, National Guard officers ordered a vehicle to stop on Guadalajara-Colima road and the passengers refused and shot at them. The officers repelled the aggression, injured an individual and arrested two men and a woman. 1 injured
On 6 March 2025, in Cuernavaca, Morelos, according to witnesses, individuals on two motorcycles shot at the vehicle of the state leader of La Familia Michoacana Cartel in the intersection of Poder Legislativo and Rio Balsas avenues, in Colonia Lomas de la Selva (drive-by). The leader died and his bodyguard was injured. A woman and her son, who travelled in a nearby vehicle, were collaterally injured. An alternative version indicates that the perpetrators drove taxi vehicles. 1 fatality, 3 injured.
Around 6 March 2025 (as reported), in Garcia, Nuevo Leon, between three and four individuals shot at municipal police officers who approached a house in the intersection of Vista Cristal and Vista Ambar streets, in Colonia Vistabella, in response to a suspected case of domestic violence. The officers arrested three individuals and seized a fireweapon and a van. There were no casualties.
On 6 March 2025, in Chilillos, Sinaloa, unidentified groups clashed. This event is linked to (narco) roadblocks set in the area (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
Around 6 March 2025 (as reported), in Tenosique de Pino Suarez, Tabasco, unidentified criminal groups clashed in Colonia Adolfo Lopez Mateos. This event followed the killing of two members of one of the groups in Colonia Colosio and led to the subsequent arrest of the group leader (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
Around 6 March 2025 (as reported), in Tenosique de Pino Suarez, Tabasco, unidentified individuals shot and killed two members of an unspecified criminal group in Colonia Colosio. This event led to a retaliation clash between both groups and the arrest of the leader of one of them (coded separately). 2 fatalities.
On 6 March 2025, in Ciudad Victoria, Tamaulipas, unidentified individuals shot at State Civil Guard officers in Colonia Chapultepec, who repelled the aggression. The officers arrested three individuals and seized two vehicles and fireweapons. There were no casualties.
On 6 March 2025, in Tuxpan, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, ministerial federal police officers chased individuals on a motorcycle in Colonia Anahuac, who shot at the officers and killed one of them. The individuals had previously shot and killed a man and injured two on Cuauhtemoc avenue, in Colonia Tropicana (coded separately). 1 fatality.
Around 6 March 2025 (as reported), in the municipality of Apatzingan (coded to Apatzingan de la Constitucion), Michoacan de Ocampo, members of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG) shot at military and State Civil Guard officers near California Ranch, who repelled the attack and killed one of the perpetrators, a Venezuelan woman. The officers seized a fireweapons, tactical equipment and a van. 1 fatality.
On 5 March 2025, in Tecate, Baja California, an armed clash with at least eight men and three men took place in Colonia Piedra Angular leading to one car crashing with a garbage truck. One person died as a result. 1 fatality.
On 5 March 2025, near Huaniqueo de Morales , Michoacan de Ocampo, there was an armed clash in the toll both of the Zamora-La Piedad road and members of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG) burned an unspecified number of vehicles and used them to set a (narco) roadblock. Between seven and ten vehicles were burned to use them to set (narco) roadblocks in events that are suspectedly linked to the release of a CJNG leader who was arrested in Zacapu on 25 February 2025 (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
On 5 March 2025, near Sevina , Michoacan de Ocampo, there was an armed clash on the Sevina-Pichataro road and members of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG) burned an unspecified number of vehicles and used them to set a (narco) roadblock. Between seven and ten vehicles were burned to use them to set (narco) roadblocks in (narco) roadblocks events that are suspectedly linked to the release of a CJNG leader who was arrested in Zacapu on 25 February 2025 (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
On 5 March 2025, in Patzcuaro, Michoacan de Ocampo, three members of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG) in a car shot at municipal police officers in the intersection of Ibarra and Espejo streets. The officers repelled the aggression, killed one of the individuals and injured and arrested the other. 1 fatality, 1 injured.
On 5 March 2025, in Cienega de Flores, Nuevo Leon, four armed individuals opened fire from their vehicle at state police officers (drive-by) and then fled the scene and were chased in Colonia Villas del Carrizalejo. One man was injured and arrested and three managed to escape the scene. 1 injury.
On 5 March 2025, in Ejido Canan, Sinaloa, unidentified individuals shot at National Guard officers on Luna street, in Sector Infonavit Humaya. The officers repelled the aggression, killed one of the individuals, arrested three and seized fireweapons and vehicles. 1 fatality.
On 5 March 2025, close to El Rosario, Sinaloa, unidentified armed men clashed with military officers in El Valamo leading to the death of one individual. 1 fatality.
On 5 March 2025, near Ojo de Agua de la Palma, Zacatecas, unidentified gang members shot at state police officers of Zacatecas Immediate Reaction Force (FRIZ), who repelled the aggression. One individual was injured and several were arrested. 1 injured.
On 5 March 2025, in El Walamo, Sinaloa, unidentified individuals and military officers clashed. One of the individuals died. 1 fatality.
On 5 March 2025, near Churintzio, Michoacan de Ocampo, members of the Jalisco New Generation Cartel (CJNG) shot at the vehicle of a high ranking officer of the National Guard officers on Mexico-Guadalajara highway, whose bodyguards repelled the aggression. Two officers were injured. This event, together with another nearby clash and (narco) roadblocks, is suspectedly linked to the release of a CJNG leader who was arrested in Zacapu on 25 February 2025 (coded separately). 2 injured.
On 5 March 2025, in Copandaro de Galeana, Michoacan de Ocampo, a group of armed men opened fire at officers of the National Guard on the Mexico-Guadalajara highway who repelled the aggression. Two officers were injured. Cars were then set on fire in different locations (coded separately). 2 injuries.
On 4 March 2025, in Linares, Nuevo Leon, unidentified individuals shot at State Civil Guard officers who approached them and repelled the aggression. The individuals fled and abandoned three vans, which were seized together with four fire weapons, tactical vests, and 18 'ponchallantas' (objects to puncture tires). Casualties unknown.
On 4 March 2025, in Santa Rita, Tamaulipas, members of the Gulf Cartel opened fire at officers of the military during surveillance and upon locating a safe house who repelled the aggression. 11 armed individuals were arrested as a result and military equipment was seized. One person was killed and four were injured. 1 fatality, 4 injured.
On 4 March 2025, in Ojo de Agua de la Palma, Zacatecas, armed individuals engaged in an armed clash with state police officers leading to the arrest of 13 men and the seizure of weapons, magazines and at least three vehicles. One state police officer was injured. 1 injury.
On 3 March 2025, in Nuevo San Juan Parangaricutiro, Michoacan, there was an armed clash between members of the CJNG and the National Guard on the Uruapan-San Juan Nuevo highway. One criminal member was killed and three others were injured and arrested. 1 fatality, 3 injured.
Around 3 March 2025 (between 2 - 3 March), in Garcia, Nuevo Leon, there was an armed clash between armed individuals and the National Guard in Colonia cerritos. One armed man was killed and another one was injured and arrested. A police officer was also injured. 1 fatality, 2 injured.
On 3 March 2025, in Villaldama, Nuevo Leon, there was an armed clash between the state police and armed individuals on the Villaldama - Sabinas highway. Armed men in a vehicle shot at the police (drive-by). The police repelled the attack. There was a car chase. The perpetrators managed to escape. Weapons and tactical equipment were seized, as part of the Operation Muralla. Casualties unknown.
On 3 March 2025, in the municipality of Caborca, Sonora, armed individuals opened fire at officers of the Navy close to Rancho Las Misiones who repelled the aggression. Three officers were injured as a result. Weapons, cartridges, tactical equipment and magazines were seized. 3 injuries.
On 2 March 2025, in Guadalupe, Nuevo Leon, at least six individuals shot at municipal police who were dismantled security cameras in the intersection of Andador and Francisco Villa streets, in Colonia Ampliacion Nuevo Mexico. Two police officers were killed and two were injured. Six individuals were arrested and the officers also seized drugs. 2 fatalities, 2 injured.
On 2 March 2025, in Montemorelos, Nuevo Leon, there was an armed clash between armed individuals on the road leading to San Vicente, at the entrance to La Soledad. One person was injured.
On 2 March 2025, in Potrerillo del Norote, Sinaloa, according to residents, there was an armed clash between armed individuals. The individuals also set several houses on fire. This event was replicated in Pueblo Nuevo community (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
On 2 March 2025, in Villanueva, Zacatecas, there was an armed clash between armed individuals and the state police forces on the Tabasco-Villanueva highway. The police officers were responding to a call of an armed clash, and it is suspected that the armed individuals (likely gangs) were involved in that same day's armed clash between gangs (coded separately). Vehicles were seized. There were no casualties.
On 2 March 2025, in Villanueva, Zacatecas, there was an armed clash between suspected rival gangs. Later, state police officers responding to the event, clashed with armed individuals on the Tabasco-Villanueva highway (coded separately).Casualties unknown.
On 2 March 2025, in Pueblo Nuevo, Sinaloa, according to residents, there was an armed clash between armed individuals. The individuals also set several houses on fire. This event was replicated in Potrerillo del Norote community (coded separately). Casualties unknown.
Around 2 March 2025 (as reported), in Sinaloa state (coded to Culiacan Rosales), a member of Los Chimales gang was held by members of Los Mayitos gang. On social media, a video showing the abductee being interrogated was posted. In the video, the kidnapped person is seen answering questions from the kidnappers with no evidence that he was beaten or tied up. The perpetrator made threats against Youtuber Camilo Ochoa. Camilo Ochoa has published dozens of videos on his Instagram channel and YouTube channel calling out the La Mayiza or Los MF criminal group. Casualties unknown.
Around 1 March 2025 (weekend of), in Costa Rica, Sinaloa, three municipal police officers were kidnapped by unidentified individuals along with their police patrol on the Culiacan-Eldorado highway on 28 February. They were killed and their bodies were found on the Culiacan-Mazatlan highway on 2 March. 3 fatalities.
On 1 March 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, two young boys had a fight (unknown reason) and both shot at each other in the Tepito area. One of them was killed and the other was injured. 1 fatality, 1 injured.
On 1 March 2025, in Chimalhuacan, Mexico, there was an armed clash between armed men in a vehicle and municipal police officers after the armed men shot at the officers (drive-by) in colonia 4 de febrero. Two armed men were killed and another 2 were injured. 2 fatalities, 2 injured.
On 1 March 2025, in Uruapan, Michoacan, there was an armed clash between armed individuals and the National Guard during a police patrol in colonia Arroyo Colorado. The armed men shot at the police from several angles. The police repelled the attack. Two armed men were killed and another one was injured. 2 fatalities, 1 injured.
On 1 March 2025, in Heroica Puebla de Zaragoza, Puebla, armed individuals in several vehicles shot at two municipal police officers during a police patrol in Colonia Del Valle (drive-by). Both police officers were killed. It is suspected by the authorities that La Barredora Gang is involved in the event. 2 fatalities.
On 1 March 2025, in Ejido El Quemadito, Sinaloa, there was an armed clash between armed individuals and military officers after the armed men shot at the authorities. Three men were killed. 3 fatalities.
Around 1 March 2025 (between 27 February - 2 March), in San Jose Miahuatlan, Puebla, nine members of a criminal group from Tlaxcala (five men and four women) were killed and their dismembered bodies were found with signs of torture inside a car on the Puebla-Oaxaca highway on 2 March. Some of the victims had a gunshot wound in the head ('tiro de gracia'). It is suspected that the victims came to Santa Maria Huatulco, from where they were abducted between the 27 and 28 February, to commit robberies under the command of the hotel businessman who was killed around 2 March in Barra Copalita (coded separately). According to a witness, the victims were abducted by local police officers. Criminal groups warned through narco-banners that they would not allow robberies in Huatulco to avoid attracting the attention of the authorities. Huatulco is a strategic point in terms of receiving cocaine and extorting money from specific sectors of the tourism industry. On 14 March 2025, federal officers searched and disarmed the municipal police officers of Santa Cruz Huatulco due to their possible links to this attack. 9 fatalities.
On 1 March 2025, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, there was an armed clash between the National Guard and military officers against four armed men in Colonia La Amistad. There were no casualties. Vehicles and weapons were seized.

### Conflict-Early-Warning Brief: Explosions/Remote Violence in Mexico, March 2025

#### Summary of Key Developments

In March 2025, Mexico experienced several incidents of explosions and remote violence, primarily in the states of Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave and Sinaloa. These events highlight ongoing security challenges and potential areas of conflict escalation.

1. **Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave (Papantla de Olarte)**:
   - On March 5, 2025, an explosive device detonated inside a package containing perfumes on Monte de Sion street, injuring a Christian pastor who lost her hand (MEX101212).
   - On March 9, 2025, a similar incident occurred on the same street, injuring a man who lost his right hand (MEX101214).

2. **Sinaloa (Carrizalejo)**:
   - On March 23, 2025, members of the Los Mayos Gang launched a drone attack on military officers in retaliation for a previous drug seizure. One of the gang leaders was later arrested around April 15, 2025. Casualties from the attack are unknown (MEX102853).

These incidents underscore the persistent threat of remote violence and the strategic use of explosives by criminal organizations. The repeated targeting of civilians and military personnel in Veracruz and the retaliatory actions in Sinaloa indicate a volatile security environment that requires continued monitoring and intervention.

### Conflict-Early-Warning Brief: Explosions/Remote Violence in Mexico, March 2025

**Summary of Key Developments:**

1. **Drones Attack on Military Officers:**
   - **Event:** On 23 March 2025, in Carrizalejo, Sinaloa, members of the Los Mayos Gang used drones to attack military officers in retaliation for a previous drug seizure. One of the gang leaders was arrested around 15 April. Casualties are unknown. (Event ID: 1)

2. **IED Incidents in Veracruz:**
   - **Event:** On 9 March 2025, an explosive device detonated inside a package containing perfumes on Monte de Sion street in Papantla de Olarte, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, injuring a man who lost his right hand. (Event ID: 2)
   - **Event:** On 5 March 2025, another explosive device detonated inside a similar package on the same street, injuring a Christian pastor who lost her hand. (Event ID: 3)

3. **Assassination in Oaxaca:**
   - **Event:** On 17 March 2025, in Puerto Escondido, Oaxaca, two men shot and killed a businessman and former mayor of San Pedro Mixtepec of the MORENA party (2022-2024) inside his spice business. The victim had run for mayor as part of the Labor Party in 2024. (Event ID: 4)

4. **Murder in Sonora:**
   - **Event:** Around 10 March 2025, in Providencia, Sonora, a man was killed and his body was found wrapped in blankets and tied with tape on Base y Jesus Garcia street. (Event ID: 5)

5. **Property Destruction in Puebla:**
   - **Event:** On 4 March 2025, in San Martin Texmelucan de Labastida, Puebla, armed individuals opened fire at the facade of a home in Colonia Solidaridad and then fled the scene. (Event ID: 6)

**Conclusion:**
March 2025 saw several significant incidents of remote violence and targeted assassinations across Mexico, highlighting ongoing conflicts involving criminal organizations and political tensions. The use of drones in attacks and the recurrence of IED incidents in Veracruz are notable trends that warrant further monitoring and analysis.

In April 2025, Mexico experienced a diverse range of protests across numerous states, reflecting a wide array of social, economic, and political grievances. Key themes included demands for better labor conditions, justice for missing persons, improved public services, and responses to various forms of violence and discrimination.

**Labor and Economic Issues:**
- Workers across various sectors, including education, healthcare, and transportation, protested for better wages, job security, and working conditions. Notable events included teachers' strikes in Guerrero (MEX102236) and Michoacán (MEX102215), and healthcare workers' protests in Veracruz (MEX102234) and Oaxaca (MEX102538).
- Farmers and agricultural workers demanded fair prices and support for their livelihoods, as seen in protests in Chiapas (MEX102169) and Tabasco (MEX102170).

**Justice and Human Rights:**
- Families of missing persons and victims of violence held numerous protests demanding justice and investigations. Significant events included protests in Veracruz (MEX102279) and Sinaloa (MEX102278) for missing persons, and protests in Guerrero (MEX102247) and Puebla (MEX102289) for justice for victims of violence.
- Protests against gender-based violence and femicides were prominent, with events in Morelos (MEX102222) and Mexico City (MEX102249) demanding greater attention to these issues.

**Public Services and Infrastructure:**
- Residents across various states protested against the lack of basic services such as water, electricity, and healthcare. Notable events included water supply protests in Puebla (MEX102590) and Veracruz (MEX102290), and healthcare protests in Sinaloa (MEX102298) and Yucatan (MEX102299).
- Protests against poor infrastructure and public services were also common, with events in Mexico City (MEX102219) and Puebla (MEX102296) demanding improvements.

**Environmental and Social Issues:**
- Environmental concerns were highlighted in protests against pollution in Jalisco (MEX102295) and deforestation in Chihuahua (MEX102287).
- Social issues such as housing and land rights were addressed in protests in Mexico City (MEX102233) and Oaxaca (MEX102512).

**Political and Legal Issues:**
- Protests against government policies and actions included events in Mexico City (MEX102545) and Jalisco (MEX102547) demanding accountability for missing persons, and protests in Puebla (MEX102553) and Veracruz (MEX102231) against government inaction.
- Legal and judicial issues were also a focus, with protests in Mexico City (MEX102542) and Puebla (MEX102548) demanding justice and fair trials.

Overall, the protests in April 2025 highlighted the multifaceted challenges facing Mexico, from economic hardships and labor rights to justice for victims of violence and improved public services. The diverse nature of the protests underscores the need for comprehensive policy responses addressing these various issues.

In April 2025, Mexico experienced a variety of protests across multiple states, reflecting a range of social, economic, and political grievances. Key events included:

1. **Labor and Economic Protests**:

On 30 April 2025, in Morelia, Michoacan, drivers of digital platforms such as Uber and Didi marched to demand better safety conditions. The event was sparked after a colleague was killed near la Ruana (coded separately).
On 30 April 2025, in Santa Maria Huatulco, Oaxaca, people and former workers of the Tangolunda golf course demonstrated at the offices of the National Commission of Natural Protected Areas (Conanp) demanding that the federal government reopen the space, which they consider vital to the destination's tourism economy.
On 30 April 2025, in Ixhuatlancillo, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, dozens of workers from the municipality protested in the framework of International Labor day and marched to the main entrance to the municipality to demand labor justice and to remember the historical memory of the workers' struggle.
On 30 April 2025, in Minatitlan, Veracruz, workers held a protest at the PEMEX facilities Lazaro Cardenas refinery to demand millions in debt owed to them from the company.
On 30 April 2025, in Mexicali, Baja California, teachers of the Jose Vasconcelos Independent Union of Educational Workers of Baja California (Sietebcjv) held a protest to demand an immediate solution to the lack of their salary payments.
On 30 April 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Benito Juarez, around 200 teachers members of the National Coordinator of Education Workers (CNTE) along with administrative workers blocked the main entrance to the Ministry of Public Education (SEP) in Colonia Xoco to demand the dismissal of the Director General of Technological Education, Agriculture, and Marine Sciences (Dgetaycm).
On 30 April 2025, in Torreon, Coahuila, members of the 'Mothers of Power' collective from La Laguna blocked access to the Pronnif (National Pronnif) demanding the payment of the benefits for orphans of femicide to be granted. The protesters demanded justice.
On 30 April 2025, in Cuernavaca, Morelos, women students of the Autonomous University of the State of Morelos (UAEM) held a protest demanding greater attention to the cases of violence against women reported at the university.
On 30 April 2025, in Atasta, Campeche, residents blocked the highway to protest against the lack of electricity.
On 30 April 2025, in Guadalupe, Nuevo Leon, residents held a protest against the construction of the Children's Hospital. The protesters declared that this will affect traffic in the area.
On 30 April 2025, in El Rosario, Sinaloa, people held a protest to demand for the search of a man who is missing since two months.

On 29 April 2025, in Chalchihuitan, Chiapas, more than a thousand Catholic people marched to demand an end to drug and alcohol sales, and violence against women. The walk was to demand peace.

On 29 April 2025, in Cosoleacaque, Veracruz, workers held a protest at the PEMEX facilities to demand millions in debt owed to them from the company.

On 28 April 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, employees of the Federal Institute of Telecommunications (IFT) protested in front of the Senate and blocked Reforma avenue to demand that their labor rights are guaranteed after the dissolution of the organization.
Around 28 April 2025 (as reported), in Tehuacan, Puebla, recyclers protested in front of the municipal palace to demand facilities that allow them to gather the necessary amount of material that they are demanded to and also to provide them facilities that fulfil the safety measures required by Civil Protection.

This event was replicated in other locations (coded separately).

On 25 April 2025, in Xicotepec de Juarez, Puebla, relatives of members of the Mexican Army and the National Guard held a protest and marched to promote support for imprisoned military personnel and fallen soldiers. The event was in support of four soldiers imprisoned for their participation in the killing of five civilians in Nuevo Laredo, Tamaulipas, in 2023. On 25 April 2025, in San Luis Potosi, San Luis Potosi, relatives of members of the Mexican Army and the National Guard held a protest and marched to promote support for imprisoned military personnel and fallen soldiers. On 25 April 2025, in Mazatlan, Sinaloa, a group of people defrauded by the developer of the Universal real estate group demonstrated to demand justice and denounce the slowness with which the criminal proceedings initiated in this regard are being carried out.
On 25 April 2025, in Ciudad Victoria, Tamaulipas, a hundred farmers protested in front of the offices of the Agrarian Court to demand attention from the authorities over their cases.
On 25 April 2025, in Ciudad Mendoza, Veracruz, family, friends, and bikers held a protest at the city center to demand the immediate return of a young man who was reported missing since last 21 April.

On 24 April 2025, in Tijuana, Baja California, a group of residents of Fraccionamiento Residencial Playas Diamante demonstrated to prevent the removal of the security booth located at the entrance to the condominiums.
On 24 April 2025, in Tuxtla Gutierrez, Chiapas, more than 60 Venezuelan migrants held a protest and demanded humanitarian flights outside the INM. The migrants asked to be returned to their country with the support of President Claudia Sheinbaum.
On 24 April 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Alvaro Obregon, around 30 people who saved their money at the Microentrepreneur Assistance Council (Came) held a protest at the National Banking and Securities Commission (CNBV) demanding answers and the return of their funds after the company has not publish their data since few months and changed of address without warning their users.
On 24 April 2025, in Teoloyucan, Mexico, residents along with the mayor (Morena party) gathered at the toll booth on the Mexico-Queretaro highway to demand that the National Water Commission (Conagua) and the State of Mexico Water Commission (Caem) provide water service in their district. On 24 April 2025, in San Francisco Pichataro, Michoacan, residents blocked the access to the town and other nearby roads after two community security officers were killed in an ambush a day before on the Pichataro-Sevina stretch (coded separately). On 24 April 2025, in Salina Cruz, Oaxaca, business owners affiliated with the Mexican Chamber of the Construction Industry (Cmic) marched to demand that Petroleos Mexicanos (Pemex) pays them the more than one billion pesos the company owes them.

On 24 April 2025, in Tecualilla, Sinaloa, land owners held a protest to demand outstanding payments for damages from canal works at the Santa Maria Dam.
On 23 April 2025, in Tapachula de Cordova y Ordonez, Chiapas, activists and migrants of Central and South American nationalities protested at the premises of Siglo XXI Migratory Station to demand more resources, the end of criminalization of migrants and to reject the migration policies of the United States.

On 23 April 2025, in Colima, Colima, residents of Colonias Tulipanes, Las Presas and Verde Valle protested in the premises of the Intermunicipal Commission of Drinking Water and Sewerage of Colima and Villa de Alvarez (CIAPACOV) to demand measures to improve the quality of the water supply.

On 23 April 2025, in Charo, Michoacan de Ocampo, Civil Guard officers protested at Lic. David Franco Rodriguez Penitentiary Center to demand higher salaries and better labor conditions. Simultaneous demonstrations took place in other locations of Michoacan state (coded separately).

According to a source, the protesters were carrying out sticks and machetes and destroyed the facilities of the Tax Administration Service (SAT). It is unknown whether there were injured.
On 23 April 2025, in Mazatlan, Sinaloa, tens of people and construction workers protested outside a house on Cruz Lizarraga avenue, in Colonia Ferrocarrilera to denounce that the U.S. owner of the house discriminated a Mexican construction worker. The incident was recorded on video and posted on social media, accusing the homeowner of racism. During the event, demonstrators kicked the door of the house and threw food at it. State police officers struggled with the protesters, dissolved the demonstration (methods unknown) and arrested a person for blocking traffic and altering public order.
On 23 April 2025, in Merida, Yucatan, residents of Tahdzibichen protested at the municipal palace to demand the mayor to guarantee their property right over their land. The demonstrators claimed that they bought it but have not yet received their property titles.

Around 22 April 2025 (as reported), in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, around 100 young athletes and their relatives blocked Paseo de la Reforma avenue by the central offices of the Social Security Institute (IMSS) to denounce that the authorities did not consider them in selections for national tournaments.

Around 22 April 2025 (as reported), in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, residents and a federal congresswoman of the Citizen's Movement party protested outside the municipal palace against the reform of urban planning regulations that would eliminate the need of an environmental impact study for new constructions.

On 21 April 2025, in Chihuahua, Chihuahua, relatives of a victim of child abuse protested outside the government palace to demand justice in the handling of the case and the review of the case for a fair sentence.

On 21 April 2025, in Huejotzingo, Puebla, residents of the teachers' housing unit protested during a visit by the mayor to demand solutions to water shortages and to demand increased police presence to guarantee safety in the area.

State police officers arrived at the scene, dispersed the protesters and arrested an unspecified number of them (methods unknown).
On 17 April 2025, in Zacatecas, Zacatecas, employees of ZigZag Interactive Center occupied the premises to demand outstanding payments.
On 17 April 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, seven members of a Catholic group protested outside the Museum of Ciudad de Mexico against an art exhibition depicting cardinals and nuns in erotic positions.

On 16 April 2025, in Aguascalientes, Aguascalientes, around 2,000 workers of the horse riding, bull fighting and cock fighting industries, taxi drivers, municipal and state employees and citizens marched along Francisco I. Madero avenue to Patria Square and the state congress to demand that such activities be considered as traditions and essential parts of San Marcos National Fair. Around 16 April 2025 (as reported), in Tijuana, Baja California, victims of a man who was arrested in Nayarit on 11 April 2023 on charges of pederasty and human trafficking protested to demand progress in the judicial process.

Around 16 April 2025 (as reported), in Coajomulco, Morelos, farmers blocked Mexico-Cuernavaca highway during five hours to demand the authorities to intervene against a wildfire in Las Palomas.

Around 16 April 2025 (as reported), in Orizaba, Veracruz de Ignacio de la Llave, members of the Popular Revolutionary Front (FPR), the National Front for Socialism (FNLS) and the Front of Revolutionary Action simulated a crucifixion in front of the premises of the Federal Commission of Electricity (CFE) to denounce the excessive bills charged to a woman in Rio Blanco.

On 16 April 2025, in Culiacan Rosales, Sinaloa, employees of the State Commission of Human Rights and relatives and friends of a woman who disappeared on 5 April 2025 marched from the cathedral and on Alvaro Obregon avenue to La Lomita to demand the authorities to locate her.
On 15 April 2025, in San Cristobal de las Casas, Chiapas, nearly 200 people from Cuxtitali El Pinar Ejido held a protest at the Municipal Administrative Unit to refute accusations against them. On 15 April 2025, in Morelia, Michoacan de Ocampo, indigenous normalista students, farmers and relatives of a student of Rural Vasco de Quiroga school who disappeared in Tiripetio on 13 April 2025 used a bus and a trailer to block Calzada la Huerta by Colonia Xangari to demand that he be located. Additional demonstrations took place in Zirahuen and Santa Maria Huiramangaro (coded separately). The student's body was found in Lagunillas on 18 April 2025 (coded separately).
On 15 April 2025, in Zirahuen, Michoacan de Ocampo, indigenous normalista students, farmers and relatives of a student of Rural Vasco de Quiroga school who disappeared in Tiripetio on 13 April 2025 blocked Siglo 21 highway by the toll to demand that he be located. The demonstrators removed the roadblock on 16 April 2025. Additional demonstrations took place in Morelia and Santa Maria Huiramangaro (coded separately). The student's body was found in Lagunillas on 18 April 2025 (coded separately).
On 15 April 2025, in Xicotepec de Juarez, Puebla, family and friends of a woman who was killed demonstrated at the municipal Zocalo to demand justice for her femicide. The event was held during the visit of the Governor.
Around 15 April 2025 (between 13 - 18 April), in Chetumal, Quintana Roo, relatives, friends and coworkers of a nurse who disappeared on 13 April 2025 blocked unspecified areas to demand the authorities to locate him. The man was killed and his body was found in the town of Nicolas Bravo around 18 April 2025 (uncoded). A man was arrested.
On 15 April 2025, in Mazatlan, Sinaloa, residents from Colonia Rincon de Urias gathered to ask for better public lighting to prevent further robberies. The event was held during the visit of the Mayor.
On 15 April 2025, in Tampico, Tamaulipas, a group of cart drivers with horses protested outside the City Hall Pet Clinic to demand the release of a horse that they claimed was illegally confiscated from them. On 15 April 2025, in Zacatecas, Zacatecas, health workers members of the National Union of Health Workers (SNTSA) took over the facilities of the State Coordination of the IMSS-Bienestar (Mexican Social Security Institute) to protest against the lack of supplies and medications at the state's five general hospitals and health centers.
On 15 April 2025, in La Paz, Baja California Sur, workers at the Child Development Center (CENDI) held a protest against the lack of their payment for three months.
On 15 April 2025, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, people held a protest at the National Palace to demand the release of a woman who was arrested four and a half years ago and accused of attacks against communication routes while protesting the disappearance and killing of a colleague.

On 14 April 2025, in Tapachula de Cordova y Ordonez, Chiapas, about 200 migrants from Venezuela protested outside the Siglo 21 Station of the National Migration Institute to demand to the authorities to facilitate their return to their country after they will not reach the United States.

On 14 April 2025, in Acapulco de Juarez, Guerrero, residents of colonia Amin Zarur held a protest at the city center to demand water service.

graphRAG_summary:
### Conflict-Early-Warning Brief: Riots in Mexico, April 2025

**Summary of Key Developments:**

In April 2025, Mexico experienced a series of riots across various states, driven by a range of grievances including public safety concerns, labor disputes, political tensions, and community disputes. The following summarizes the key events:

1. **Lynchings and Mob Violence:**
   - Several incidents involved mob violence and lynchings, often in response to alleged crimes. For instance, in Tlaxcala (MEX102158), a man was lynched and burned by residents after being accused of sexual assault. Similar incidents occurred in Puebla (MEX103452, MEX103153) and Mexico State (MEX103453), where individuals accused of various crimes were beaten and burned by mobs.

2. **Protests and Labor Disputes:**
   - Labor disputes and protests were prevalent. In Coahuila (MEX102502), residents clashed with police during an eviction attempt, resulting in one fatality. In Michoacán (MEX102304, MEX102661), normalista students demonstrated and engaged in vandalism to demand better school conditions and financial resources.

3. **Community and Political Tensions:**
   - Community tensions and political disputes also fueled riots. In Guerrero (MEX102925), taxi drivers blocked roads to demand security measures. In Puebla (MEX102661), merchants and students protested against perceived injustices and demanded the return of funds. In Nuevo León (MEX102595), residents protested against public transport fare increases.

4. **Public Safety and Crime-Related Riots:**
   - Public safety concerns led to several riots. In Tabasco (MEX103212), a confrontation between union members resulted in one fatality. In Michoacán (MEX102665), residents demanded the release of arrested students, leading to clashes with police. In Veracruz (MEX102497), residents beat a man accused of sexual assault.

5. **Political and Electoral Violence:**
   - Political tensions and electoral disputes also contributed to riots. In Michoacán (MEX103448), suspected supporters of MORENA threw chairs at a senator during a political event. In Puebla (MEX103457), supporters of a candidate for assistant inspector disrupted polling stations, leading to the suspension of elections.

**Conclusion:**
The riots in Mexico during April 2025 highlight deep-seated issues related to public safety, labor disputes, community tensions, and political conflicts. These incidents underscore the need for effective conflict resolution mechanisms and community engagement to address underlying grievances and prevent further escalation.

**Key Developments:**

1. **Student Protests and Violence:**
   - **Palo Blanco, Guerrero (30 April):** Over 200 students from the Ayotzinapa Normal School, members of the Federation of Socialist Peasant Students of Mexico (FECSM), threw firecrackers and Molotov cocktails at a toll booth on the Autopista del Sol Mexico-Acapulco Highway to demand justice for the killing of a CECOP leader.

   - **Michoacan de Ocampo (9-10 April):** Normal rural students in various locations, including Morelia, Tiripetio, and San Francisco Pichataro, demonstrated and set up blockades to demand better school conditions and the release of arrested students.
